description: This has become one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. I love, love, love the decor and the environment. I absolutely enjoy the atmosphere and the backyard garden is wonderful if you're on a date. The drinks are reasonably priced and the bartender was very nice. I had a great time here and cannot wait to return.
author: Dawson M.

description:
Came here during pride weekend and had a great time!  The bar has a wonderful funky vibe inside, and I felt pretty welcome there immediately.  As soon as we walked in a table of ladies were sitting at one of the tables near the entrance, the immediately engaged myself and my family in some light hearted ribbing.

The bartenders were all nice and the drink prices were good.  We didn't sit on the patio, which is apparently very nice, because we didn't realize until we were leaving that there is a second area other than the spot you can see right from the door.

Although this is a "lesbian bar" it also has a neighborhood bar vibe to it as well.  I saw plenty of straight couples there in addition to the LGBT patrons.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Last night was the second and LAST time stepping foot into Wild Side West, the treatment that my friends, fiancé and I received from the female Caucasian bartender was nothing short of discriminatory, rude, and borderline racist. We left the bar with sentiments of humiliation, embarrassment, and complete disappointment.
First, I'd like to point out that, as a member of the LGBT community, for a lesbian bar that has been around for years, screaming liberation on their walls in a sanctuary city and has a big sign that welcomes all race, age, gender, religion etc. the bartender's actions last night spoke exactly the opposite of what a lesbian bar in San Francisco is supposed to represent however, by the other reviews I've read, I might not have been the only one that has had an unforgettable experience. 
My Fiancé and I came in for a couple of drinks last night and to play pool, (her grandparents/family have been living in the Bernal Heights neighborhood for decades) we hung out waiting for our turn for the pool table and a couple of friends; from the start the bartender wasn't entirely friendly (ok no big deal, maybe she's having a bad night). I was at the bar ordering my second drink by the time our friends arrived, the moment they walked in she was watching them waiting for her chance to check ID's, of course that's your job; do that. I've just never seen any bartender so eager to check someone's ID before (from that point on the bartender started to get very agitated, one of the ID's happened to be a passport because my friend is from Guatemala). My fiancé was at the pool table getting ready for our game of pool when the bartender asked what they wanted to drink and the designated driver politely said he was just going to be playing pool and his boyfriend was good for the moment and still deciding, then she says extremely rude "IT'S A BAR GUYS YOU GOTTA ORDER DRINKS OR YOU GOTTA GO" ok, so at that point I gave my 2nd drink that I just BOUGHT to my friend that's not driving so that issue was solved. We were going to play our game of pool that we just PAID FOR and leave because in all of my years of going to bars with friends and one person out of the group isn't drinking because we're trying to get home SAFE and the other hasn't decided what he wanted yet, NEVER has it been a big deal. She kept harassing us saying "IT'S A BAR GUYS" yeah, clearly we know where we came? So, I asked her "Why is it a huge issue? We bought drinks except one person that's driving? And we're paying to play pool?" and with no logical or reasonable explanation she said "If you don't like it then you can all leave!" Even the other people at the bar stared and seemed a little uncomfortable. I was very shocked to be treated this way, the bartender kept staring us down to see if we were leaving then came from behind the bar to the pool table to tell us a 2nd time that if we weren't buying anything then we must leave even though I just bought a drink from her and gave it to my friend, does it matter who bought it? We skipped out on our pool game and left. At this point it's clear we were not welcome and it just so happens we were the only people of color in the bar that were not accompanied by a white person and the only people that were getting approached like this, it was humiliating, dehumanizing, discriminating, and flat out wrong. People come to this city to get away from inequality issues, not to get treated like this, it shouldn't be ok anywhere but we wouldn't have expected this type of service at a lesbian bar. There are still gaps to be filled within the LGBT community itself and experiences like these make it so much harder for people to come together in a time when the world is so full of hate and divide. To the owner of Wild Side West (god forbid if that bartender was the owner) make sure you have bartenders representing what you preach on your walls because this is so much more than just a bar for some people, it could be a haven but disappointingly enough there is no safe space here for people of color.
author: Angelica V.

description:
Wild Side West is a one of a kind dive in SF. As one of the last (and oldest) lesbian locales in the city, it has a special kind of charm and magic that really make queers like me feel at home. 

My girlfriend and I came by on a Tuesday evening just looking for a beer before grabbing dinner. We sat at the bar and were served promptly by a friendly bartender. 

They have pretty basic beers on tap (Guinness, Anchor Steam and the like) as well as some well distributed crafts like Deschutes Fresh Squeezed and a rotating Fort Point. They've got a full bar and cans / bottles as well, plus chips if you're needing something to tide your tummy over. 

The real magic of this place is the whimsical decor, welcoming atmosphere and the lovely mix of humans (I especially enjoy how many older lesbians frequent the place!). The back patio / secret garden is an absolutely magical setting that will have you questioning whether you're really in the middle of a metropolitan city. You really have to experience it for yourself. 

Like I said, I love that this is an absolutely welcoming dive -- sometimes you want to play a round of pool or just drink a cheap beer at the bar and stare at a TV without having to listen to drunken male conversation or worry about watching your back as a queer woman. Wild Side West provides that opportunity. 

I am concerned with the recent bad experiences with bartenders I've read from other Yelpers -- I'm glad I got lucky on a good day but I really hope management at Wild Side will take those to heart and weed out / correct any misogynistic or overtly, unnecessarily rude behavior from their staff.
author: Alex K.

description:
My partner and I were in search of a lesbian bar and were pleasantly surprised to find this hidden gem. Walked in and fell in love immediately. The decor is historic, cozy, and fun. The clientele the night we went in was predominantly female/lesbian which was nice and awesome. 

HOWEVER...never in my life have I ever experienced such rude and horrible service (I live in Las Vegas). The male bartender was unwelcome and blatntly rude. My gf and I sat at the bar and literally every person he served asked him what was wrong and apologized to HIM. He ignored everyone. 

I get we all have bad days but I still think it was inexcusable. It's a shame because we loved everything else about this bar.
author: Vanessa A.

description: Good place to come for late night drinks at a neighborhood dive eclectic bar. Cash only I believe.
author: TJ S.

description: If you are racist, hipster, techie and/or anything in that nature.... This bar is for you.... As a Born and raised mission native, I treat anyone that is visiting or moving to this city with pure kindness... These bartender's are completely disgusting!!!! I understand that when going to a bar you must buy drinks (duh!) All five of my friends ordered drinks except for me. The bitch bartender told me to leave since I wasn't ordering anything drinks??? I put my pride aside and explained to her that 1. I was going to be the driver, and 2. I have type 1 diabetes and don't drink. The snobby bitch had the nerve to tell me I should go to a bar that better suits me!?! I then got really pissed yelled all type of shit and then got kicked out...
author: Alley K.

description: Please do not give your business to this bar. I had the most upsetting experience I've ever had at a bar in my life at Wild Side West.  The bartender told me and my friend that we could not be in the bar because we "looked young." I am 28 years old, and when I tried to show him my California Drivers license he would not look at the ID. He refused to serve us and continued to ask us to leave. Discrimination against two women who appear young is completely disgusting and wrong. I will never come back to this bar again.
author: Ashley F.

description: I was super excited to come to my first lesbian bar here in the city. My experience sucked. I just moved here. I have my Texas id and it was bent from use. I didn't get served and when I asked if they could scan my id i was told no. I'm 33 and have bartended at lgbt bars for the past 7 years. I was hoping to feel welcome in a city that is known for welcoming us and instead I ended up walking for an hour trying not to be to upset from my whole day and then the ending.
author: Ekta K.

description:
What a cool little spot! A few friends and I were looking for a bar and needed: outside patio, full bar and most importantly, open. And we found a real winner with Wild Side West-

The bar is what you would expect of a true neighborhood local- a bit "loved" on the inside but a spot where everyone is friendly and the drink pours are hearty. 

The best part about this bar in my opinion is that it's dog friendly and that there's a massive back garden area where you can sit and hang out. It feels like you're having a drink in a secret garden or something, and you can tell from the groups of people hanging out that everyone is friends.
author: Elliott W.

description: Love Wild Side.  Great neighborhood bar.  5 stars for fab bar and first bar I've seen with paper straws!!!!
author: Barbara A.

description:
Loved the dark-haired, tattooed bartender who gave the history of the bar, owners, and activities that occur.  The outside patio and garden removes you from the city and places you in this intimate area to just hangout.  The uniquely decorated garden has a lot of random stuff, for example, there are plastic, ceramic, stone, or metal legs placed throughout.  This is also the most (or last) lgbt female-friendly bar in SF and is very welcoming to guys and straight people.

This is the coolest dive bar, hidden in Bernal Heights, that I've ever been to and the drinks and locals are just really pleasant and laid back!
author: Mee-Jin Y.

description: This is a great lesbian and Bernal local bar! Check your attitude at the door and you'll have a great time. Cash only.
author: Amaris B.

description: Great little friendly dive bar. Fantastic vibe, but when I ordered my Guinness they did it all in one pour. Anyone behind a bar that serves Guinness should know how to properly pour the stout.
author: David A R.

description:
A cool place to visit from a historical perspective but nothing else appealed to me. It was a bit out of the way but we made the trek via uber without any issues. It's a place you can sit and have drinks and although there is a small dance floor and DJ there were not many people dancing. The decor is eclectic and interesting. 
I guess it depends what you are looking for. If you are looking for dancing or finding someone to potentially date this probably is not the place. But if you want to relax with friends in a bar this could work.
author: Alison H.

description:
I've been coming to Wild Side West for about 6 or 7 years and I am deeply sadden by last night (possibly racist, but certainly disappointing) experience. I've happen to only come here with white people in the past and never had any issues. Last night was different. 

After a queer girl party @ El Rio, I wanted to take my friends (who happen to be black) to the first place myself and my girlfriend went on a date 2 years ago. Having just stopped for ice cream (we weren't drunk) I thought a sip in their garden would be magical. 

When we first approached the door, I asked the young woman with the shaved head and piercings if the backyard was still open. "Oh yeah, of course" she waved me off. I said "Yes, but I know it closes at 10p, right?" Looking down at my watch I saw it was about ten to 9p. "It'll close at 10ish/10:30p tonight" is what she said. 

Having confirmed the garden was open, I ushered myself and 4 friends inside, excited. 

My friends have never been there before, so before we ordered drinks I wanted to secure my favorite spot in the garden. We walked downstairs, and after checking a few nooks, we found a spot. As we are putting our things away and getting settled, the same person from the door approaches us. 

"My manager sent me. You have to buy drinks if you want to be here" 

No problem really, but it was a bit creepy, seeing as we were tucked in this fold and she came right to us. I told her as much. 

"Yes, there are cameras everywhere. She's watching me right now." 

UH OK SUPER CREEPS. We all started to look around in the trees. I had never seen a camera there, ever. But I understand you have to buy drinks to kick it. We send a couple of friends to buy drinks so we can hold down the spot. 

After they get back with rounds, my friends try to teach me how to play rummy using a deck of cards. About 15 minutes after we get our drinks, the same girl approaches us: 

"My manager is upstairs and says it's too loud. I have to close the garden. I've opened the deck for you though" 

Surprised I say " I thought that the garden didn't close until 10p? It's 9:40p" 

Door person (and bartender) says: "Bar time is different" as she is walking away. 

Now, what in the BLAZES does that mean? 

The vibe was: black voices carry, and we don't want to hear yours. 

Confused, we gather our things. 

Thinking that maybe she hadn't accounted for daylight savings time, I mention that she said the back wouldn't close until "10ish" and that it's only 9:40p. I also mention I've been coming here for about 6 years and the garden has always closed at 10p, quiet hours. 

Perhaps the door person/bartender was trying to be cool with us, but it just came off as condescending to be called "boo" (equivalent to "sweetie") as she dodged the question and said they are working on getting a permit to allow the garden to remain open all night. 

"We have to keep the neighbors happy" said door person/bartender. 

"Yes, but the garden is always open until 10p, the time you told me walking up". She said nothing. 

My friends and I tried to make it work on the patio, but the magic of the garden was lost. We left in silence, and I was embarrassed to have taken my friends to one of the last "lesbian bars" in SF. 

Wild Side West: although there aren't many black folks in SF, we are still here. I was hoping that it was okay to be black, queer, and have a good time within your bar, but it didn't feel safe at all, and pretty much we weren't left alone the whole time we were there. I guess El Rio it is from now on. 

I still have all the loving memories, including the first date with my girlfriend (who happens to be white) 2 years ago and I suppose those will have to suffice.
author: Mercedes G.

description:
So reading a lot of peoples bad reviews on this bar is pretty sad. For one, this bar has been here for years as well as a ton of good people. INCLUDING all the bartenders. 
The first time I came to this bar, the girl with the shaved head &piercings was such a sweetheart to me. I ordered my drink &decided to start up a conversation with her. Didn't have any problems. 

Can't really understand why some people on these reviews I'm reading are calling her a racist &condescending? I never really got that impression, so I'm a bit confused. She, nor any of the bartenders I've had really gave me that vibe. 

I was told that they had a garden &patio so I went to check it out. She said they close it at 10, so I said "Ok, cool just let me know when it's time." It was absolutely beautiful. After being down there for about half an hour, the bartender told me that she'd be closing up the garden soon because there wasn't a lot of people going down there anyways. She explained that they were working on Bar Time which I can understand being that it was busier in the bar than in the backyard that night. But she said I could finish my cigarette up on the patio &that it would be open for a while, at least until people start being loud, then they'll have to close up to respect the neighbors.

 Totally understood. She kept checking up on me to see if I was having a good time &see if I needed another drink, so that was pretty cool. I got really good vibes from this bar, so far, haven't had a bad night here. 
Been coming here for a while now.

In all honesty, some reviews, I think, is a defamation of character on these bartenders. Don't assume that because they call you dollface, hun, boo, that it's condescending. Some people just talk like that. I didn't mind it, but if you're insecure about someone calling you that, speak up &let them know.  
Please be considerate of people coming or working at this bar. Everyone deals with a lot of shit everyday, so don't take every little thing your bartender or people around you say, up the ass. You probably just had a bad day, don't make it harder on people at the bar trying to have a good night. You guys are taking these reviews too personally. All bartenders, no matter what bar you go to, go through a lot of bullshit throughout their day of dealing with drunks. They call it Bar Time for a reason. 

So far, I've met so many awesome people here, so if it's your first time, or you've been there forever, spark up conversation with people! This is the best place to make new friends or acquaintances!! If you get here early, enjoy the garden before it gets dark out!!! 

They also play basketball, baseball, &football on the TV's. I've gotten food delivered to me there as well. Pretty awsome bar to chill at &unwind after work. Thank you Wild Side for your services!! Hope you all enjoy!!!! Also, thank you lady piercings on the customer service!
author: Noreen M.

description:
What makes a bar special are the people and the top person on my list is Tina. She is the type of bartender that knows your name, remembers your drink and goes out of her way to make your experience golden. If I'm having a rough day, I pass by and see who's behind the bar--if it's Tina, I stop in and know I'm going to have my spirits lifted. 

Overall, WSW is a great place. I love all of the different environments of the decks and yard. It's fun to bring out-of-towners for drinks because of its uniqueness. The little shoes with shrubs, the pool table, and the warm and friendly atmosphere. 

Thanks, Tina and everyone for doing a great job!
author: Shelley C.

description:
Cash only!

Great neighborhood bar, decent craft beer selection and they have a pool table. So bonus for that. 

I heard the outside area is pretty nice too, but I didn't see it since it was too cold for me.
author: Mike G.

description: Cool, very casual bar with lots of local girls. The bar is pet friendly. Would recommend to women who like their ladies rugged and casual!
author: Christina F.

description:
Love the ambiance! However..I came here the other night for the 3rd time (every other time was great). I ordered a dirty Shirley but the bartender was an entitled asshole who refused to make my drink. She replied to my order with a, "really? It's so bad for you though.." And then called over another bartender to make it for me. I order bitch drinks all the time and have never had someone react that way. 1. Thanks for making me feel stupid. 2. Don't be a bartender if you can't handle making "annoying" drinks. 3. Alcohol in general is bad for you... 
The bartender was a female with black hair shaved on the sides and face piercings. She should be fired IMMEDIATELY lol
author: Rachael C.

description: This place really sucks when it comes to sports. Don't come here if you want to watch sports or anything other than the crappy movies they put on. The bar staff is really un-welcoming, unless your a regular. The bartenders here are the worst! Surprised they've been around for so long. Don't let people like this get away with terrible customer service, and an unwelcoming attitude. Email: info@wildsidewest.com and let the owner know what's up.
author: J M.

description: Nice place for a drink. It was pretty quiet when we were there. Very stormy out and I think that kept the crowds away. Friendly bartender and other "ladies" there for a Saturday drinkie. Strong  well priced (cheap) drinks. Love all the liberal shit posted up everywhere on the walls. I felt right at home. Only 4 stars because two reasons.. the place I sat, at the front hook of the bar, reminded me of a person that hadn't showered in weeks..a little like piss, and old spilled liquor. It was kinda gross and I could've happily just moved but we were only there to check it out and head out for a live music show. The other reason is the location is sort of out of the way, and there aren't a lot of other places to stumble around too. But catch a quick LYFT and you're all set.
author: Nicole O.

description: Oh Dear Wild Side, you're forever loved and cherished despite your sour smell, trashed garden and underwhelming spirit selection. Bartenders are solid. Homoriffic history is upheld in upmost honor. I'll go again soon accepting all that you are.
author: Catherine C.

description: Wanted to love because there are so few  "safe spaces" for queer girls nowadays. However it was cold as ice walking in, and I am not talking temperature. Barely had a greeting from the bartender and all of the fellow guests were glaring at us from go. The drinks were decent priced but the staff was so rude. To top it off a clearly drunk "regular" got in my spouse's face about something ridiculous and completely unwarranted. SHE was lucky we weren't in the mood to make a bigger scene because it was all quite childish and insane and the bartender then took her side. If you could take a tip back, we would have. Then she continued to ignore us, never said goodbye or thank you. They were also clearly serving underage kids who were playing pool. What a disappointment. Never coming back.
author: Amy R.

description:
My people! Love the garden. Love the crowd! Love the pool table!

LOVE LOVE LOVE

don't come here if you're part of the new gut remodel love bugs, this ain't the place.
Here, we like things with a vintage touch. We value history. We love our City by the Bay and Wild Side West is a HUGE PART OF S.F. History.
author: shanestar h.

description:
Best fuckin bar on Cortland, hands down! The bartenders are ALL very cool, the pours are heavy handed, great outdoor patio, and old movies always playing on the tv. It is rumored that the pool table used to belong to Janis Joplin. There's a piano against the wall, and very interesting nudes hanging above it. It's where I learned how to play piano by ear for the 1st time.

This bar will always have a special place in my heart. I always meet great friends and interesting characters here. May you never go away. We await the return of Mr. Nancy from her surgery. Gotta love that salty gal! If you have an issue with the sometimes surly old gal bartenders here you don't get the joke, you're overly sensitive, or you are the joke. lol I hear this about my favorite bars all over town, and ya know what? It's not them. IT'S YOU. Grow roots elsewhere. We are from here, and we ain't goin anywhere, transplants!

Find a Marina douche suck up bar that will cater to your fragile needy ass. Ya wanna stiff drink, be left alone, or socialize with the quirkiest, arty, locals than do. If ya don't like them, WE DON'T LIKE YOU.
author: Stella T.

description: Geessh.. talk about making you feel uncomfortable...The atmosphere is really cold and awkward.  When my girl and I walked in the door people looked at us from head to toe. If you aren't a usual/local person here don't come here. A girl playing pool bumped in to my girl didn't apologize ,more like gave her a look like she did something wrong. Of course she is a local here. Not a good atmosphere or vibe at all
author: Gabriela E.

description: Came at night with the friendly Clark Kent bartender and the next day with the grouchy gal bartender. I don't need someone to beg to be my friend so it doesn't bother me when I don't get small talk . Clearly I like this place and I'm straight. I love the old movies playing on TV , I love the backyard , we were upstairs , I like the sun on me while I sip a Whiskey Sour. Really cool inside with a pool table and really cool outside upstairs and downstairs . Met friendly chatty locals . I'll be back.
author: Cecilia D.

description: I proudly bring out of town visitors to this bar because of its history and outdoor seating downstairs, EVERY TIME I HAVE GONE, the bartenders never give a warm welcome or smile.  The beer is cold and the atmosphere is great but the bartenders are not inviting at all.   One star for cold beer.  My guests felt like an inconvenience.
author: Valerie I.

description:
Honestly can't believe I have not already written a review about the Wild Side West. I've been coming here for years, as it is one of the great Bernal Bars. 

The best part about this bar is the electic backyard, this really is a great beer garden with multiple areas for getting together groups of people. Backyard swings, gazebos, art everywhere and beautiful plants. On a sunny day, you can find me swinging on the bench sippin' beers or manhattans.

And you know I'm having fun if I'm loading up the jukebox and singing like it's my party, because the vibe here is cool and comfortable like that. We come here to have fun, play pool, enjoy the sun and a couple cocktails. It's as Bernal as I am and I love that. ;)
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Ole Wild Side. 
Just up the hill and nestled in the perfect neighborhood for its demographic. Unpretentious, divey, interesting, and lively. 
This place has its share of regulars but they are never unwelcoming. The outdoor space is worth a visit on a nice day- sort of a beer garden feel. Lesbians do love their outdoor spaces.  =)
My only gripe would be with one consistently rude day time bartender. But hey! I guess everyone has their quirks! (Note to self: limit the small talk with said bartender.) 
This little eclectic place gets somewhat busy on weekend nights, trivia nights, etc. It can sometimes be too tight for a group. But if you arent opposed to snuggling up next to the lovely ladies of Bernal Heights and company.. check out Wild Side!
author: Sydney S.

description:
One star, for the cool backyard....that's it. Unless you've grown roots in this neighborhood bar, expect to be treated like dirt...um, no thank you that's what is outside. 
Maybe sometime during the week you might find a decent bartender there, but on a Saturday afternoon you may come across dragon lady. She is just plain rude and obviously miserable with her station in life. Here's a tip, don't ask for a glass of water because she'll just point to a plastic container at the back of the bar. Gross.
Change is good, and when it comes to bars change tips well. I love the character of this place, but the service is so off putting I'd much rather pass and get a drink elsewhere.
Go to Holy Water
author: Sneakrs 1.

description: easy access.   the fab 24 line.  if you really need uber go elsewhere. bring your own chess set to the patio.   score a mojito on the way and sip it to a checkmate.
author: William S.

description: This is the greatest place that America has ever made. Everyone here is an old mean homo. And they are drunk. And there is a beautiful back garden. And there are androgynous women. And one of them wears a baseball hat which features a cartoon of bacon. Be mean to someone and have a drink, then you will be bffs. It is cheers for queers.
author: Megan G.

description:
I came in to break bills for some change and saw Janis Joplin on the wall so I decided to stay for a beer. During my brief visit I enjoyed the musical stylings of The Cure, The Kinks, and others.  Perfect soundtrack for a Saturday afternoon.
My visit was brief for a few reasons.  I got a super icey vibe from the bartender. Cash only so I had to break in to my emergency stash (mildly annoying).  And no food.
author: Melissa R.

description:
Wild Side West is another dive bar we hit while I was in SF. This place was pretty dead, but then again it was a Tuesday night. There were a couple ladies playing pool and a couple of older gentlemen who seemed to be regulars at this eclectic bar. The decor at this place was crazy cool. I just wish it was happening like others had reviewed. 

The lady working the bar was extremely nice and patient as we were indecisive and ended up only getting some soft drinks. I know I know, but we were looking to be able to catch up and ended up not drinking at all. Although we may have been cheap patrons we did have a great time laughing it up and trying to take pictures. I would like to come back on the weekend during my next trip out to the Bay area.
author: Gloria R.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars in sf, great friendly bartenders and great friendly crowd. ALot of times I've brought pizza to share with everyone.
   They have alot of   great beers on tap an sure know how to make a great drink too.
YOU definitly gotta check out the patio. Its nice and very unique.
The jukebox is one of my favorites in the bay, definitly a great david Bowie selection.
Definitly a great area, its a dive that I love diving into . Theres no sharks when you dive into this dive.  Mostly alot of great dolphins.   They really seem to rep all my favorite sports teams here too, yeeeeeeeeeah buddy!
author: Luke S.

description: I've been coming to this bar for years and I've always had nothing short of a great experience each time! Great bartenders and super cool atmosphere of decor and nature! Also serves as a nice quiet place to bring friends :D
author: Sally M.

description: A civic treasure, a place to drink & socialize in a unique setting with professional, well made drinks served with panache and style. The kitche decor and ambiance  engages the senses while you relax and unwind in this artistic & welcoming oasis in the City. I have been coming here for many years &  I never cease to be amazed by the beauty of the surroundings and of the people who work here and frequent this :  "Only in San Francisco" kind of bar.
author: Armando C.

description: Everything you want in a funky neighborhood bar.  Friendly tenders, reasonable prices, banged up wooden floors, crazy eclectic decor all over the place, and a steady stream of folks who seem cooler than me, but not pretentiously cool, just "I am sorry I am just cool" cool.  Plus the backyard garden is awesome.  If you are strolling around in Bernal and need someplace to pop in for a drink or three, this is definitely the place.
author: Doron A.

description: The decor was cool, the bartender was a bitch. It was lonely and simple I expected more and better hospitality.
author: Mo G.

description: what a fun bar for gays. I had a great time here meeting new people
author: Salima T.

description:
Very divey kind of vibe.  You walk in, and it's dark and dank.  Then you find your way all the way to the back and discover a little oasis in the backyard.  Just a hodgepodge of benches and lawn chairs and outdoor furniture and swings surrounded by some random and nice landscaping.  

Any place that has outdoor seating like this is good in my book.
author: Nina B.

description: This is a little garden gem in the middle of a great neighborhood off of Cortland.  It is a perfect place to relax, have a drink or coffee, do a little work and enjoy being outside on a sunny day.
author: Nathan M.

description:
I was told many times before my arrival at Wild Side West that this is a lesbian bar. It was as if I was supposed to prepare for a public castration by a roomful of women dressed like the "Girl with a Dragon Tattoo."  What I encountered here was quite the opposite. Maybe it was because it was relatively early for a Saturday, but the large majority of folks there were men. Everyone I encountered, whether friend or stranger, was straight. This retaught me the valuable lesson of never judging a book by its cover. I've been to many gay and lesbian bars in my day and the folks are some of the friendliest and welcoming I've known. 

I enjoyed a couple different refreshing draft beers while lounging around a large round table in the center. It was freezing cold outside and on the verge of raining, but you would have never known from the bar's the warm and cozy interior. They even had a nice little back patio.

Bernal Heights is one of my favorite little SF neighborhoods, so I can almost guarantee that I'll be back soon.
author: Alex L.

description: Great outdoor area, pool table, and cheap drinks. Female bartender is always cold/rude.
author: Laurel M.

description: Terrible "service" rudest staff I've ever encountered anywhere and I'm about as nice as a person can get.  Our whole group gave this place several chances, but left each time disgusted. We all walked across the street to the Lucky Horseshoe where the staff was impeccable, the owner drank with us, GREAT live music. Don't bother with Wild Side West unless you like overpriced, watered drinks, crap service, and the smell of moth balls.
author: Lorriane C.

description:
This is a place to be experienced, not to write about. But I guess this is Yelp and I should write SOMETHING. 

I stumbled upon Wild Side West as I was renting a place in the neighborhood and was just pleased as a plum with everything about it. It sort of had a weird smell and was terribly dingy, but that's the allure of the place! The drinks are cheap, the clientele is varied and you have all these tiny alcoves downstairs and out in the back where you can hide and make out with someone... if that's your prerogative. It wasn't mine...that night... but now I know ;)
author: Valentina V.

description:
This has been the end of the line Friday nightcap for me and my wife for years.

Nothing fancy, just a fun western themed bar to relax have a drink a chat with your neighborhood friends.

The bartenders are friendly the crowd is a great mix and the drinks aren't too expensive.

I'll be back again next week.
author: Sara A.

description: Yayyy for Heather and Rory. Anita too, her book is fabulous. Rory's antics are far too amusing to not return. Known John for quite some time and always good to see him working. Mike, ooh, aka Master Chef, provides the best of foods for all. Usually there's a Hot Dog steamer with wienies, veggie ones too, sometimes hot links. This is simply a downright neighborhood bar that knows how to treat and keep their patrons. There's a most peaceful backyard too, for all those who haven't one, to enjoy. Plenty of comfy seating for when you feel need to "be on the sidelines" awhile. Can pass on the moldy oldies TV shows LOL, crowd very caring and kind, makes up for that. Easy, safe parking in a good community oriented area.
author: Jean C.

description: Great patio. Cheap drinks. Funky crowd. Come by on the trivia night and have a great time.
author: Chris R.

description:
New favorite bar! Great bartender, great drinks, good prices, and, oh, the patio!

Went for my lady's work event, and we ended spending the entire afternoon there. Why leave when the Bloody Marys flow like wine and the music is so good (yay for iPod DJing)?

Really fun and quirky bar. Way, way better than the Lexington. I wish it wasn't at the TOP of Bernal, but I guess it keeps the young riff raff out (would say that my girl and I were at the younger end of the patron spectrum). And hey, we burned off at least a drink's worth of calories walking our bikes up. 

Pretty standard drinks and liquor offerings, FYI, and it's BYOFood, although I did enjoy a bag of Crunchy Cheetos because why not. 

Super fun joint. I'll be back for sure.
author: Allison S.

description:
Love this place - yes it is a Lesbian bar, everyone is cool and would like to keep it that way. Certain bartenders are exceptionally cool and make a great cocktail.

One time I was in here with friends and 10 strippers came in to hang out and have a pow wow on the top back porch - wow great pow wow!!
author: Rew C.

description:
We were here Saturday night - Scavenger Hunt Pub Crawl - Nearly 20 of us.

I regret that I forgot the name of the awesome bartender; Natalie? Something like that I believe. Either way - Awesome!

The bartender completely got behind our scavenger hunt and had a blast with us. We were a rowdy bunch having an amazing time, laughing our collective butts off and taking all kinds of pictures as part of the hunt.  

The patrons were crazy fun too. We were a big crowd and entering a bar was on par with flashmobbing it because we completely took over each establishment we visited. In this bar, everyone wanted to be part of the party.

There were arm wrestling matches, piggy back rides, group hugs, drink chugging contests... all with complete strangers! The patrons were totally on board and having a blast with us.

The drinks were good, the prices were more than fair, the atmosphere was 'neighborhood dive bar' (seriously, we all know that's the best kind, right?), and we had a truly memorable time.

Loved this place.
author: Christopher J.

description:
This place is AMAZING!! Great for a nice afternoon with a couple of friends or for a late drink and some pool. It is especially amazing because of the incredible backyard that has lots of private areas for you and your friends. 

Bonus points: I left my makeup bag in the bathroom (promise I only had one cider) and a couple days later when I traced back my steps I realized it was at WSW. I called after work and no answer, no biggy I figure they can't hear it every time especially if it's busy. Anyway, I found them on facebook and shot them a message. They got back to me in less than 24 hours and told me they had found it and would keep it in a safe place! 

Bottom line: this is an amazing bar, with a ton of history, great + cheap drinks, BEAUTIFUL backyard that makes me forget I live in San Francisco, and a very kind staff who don't steal your junk!!
author: Brooke W.

description: My girlfriend and I went here on a Saturday night expecting a lesbian bar and oddly when we walked in it was a massive sausage fest! We walked out immediately, very confused, questioning whether we went to the right place! We triple checked and we were definitely in the right place. I don't know if it was an off night of if it's more of mixed crowd or what, but I would never go back after having walked into that sausage factory!
author: Michelle D.

description: This place is a lot of fun. The barmaid Roary was especially charming, and made me feel very welcome there. I'll be back.
author: Bernal R.

description:
I have been a bartender  in this town for over twenty years now, so I feel as though I have seen it all....but today I was getting my dog groomed so I had a few hours to kill and I wound up at Wild  Side West .We were served round after round of beers unopened! Not sure if she wanted us to take them to go or what ?"No  "thank you" or facial recognition at all ! I got it ,that we are not salty regulars ,but  that's kinda  bullshit!.  Maybe accepting new people who are happy to tip and bring others 
who might like this place... Only reason I am in this area getting my dog groomed here is cause my friend owns the butchery and I am trying to support local
author: Chris L.

description:
A bar with history and a backyard patio.  I find that many of the patrons are locals on the older side.  The drinks are OK, the atmosphere is divvy - and dirty all around.  Watch out for the mosquitoes in the back yard.

Also has 2 big TVs in the bar - a negative for me.
author: Spoon G.

description:
I freaking love this bar!!

Went here for the first time about a couple months ago because my boyfriend works right down the block so one night we decided to grab a quick drink.

Its very big and spacious.. they have a back patio and a huge back yard downstairs with tons of places to sit and very good for groups of people. They even have a little bbq area (that you can rent out) which is really cool.

If I did have one complaint... it would be about one of their female bar tenders was really rude. I'm not much of a drinker at all.. I'm usually the designated driver but when I do have a drink.. I enjoy having a Sex on the Beach because it's not to strong. So when I went and ordered one she gave me this horrible look and rolled her eyes at me.. I was so confused I even had to ask my boyfriend like "did she just roll her eyes at me" .. It kind of rubbed me the wrong way but I didn't let it ruin my night I just figured that she just cut her tip in half.

Besides that, I overall really love this bar. The rest of the Staff & the Owner Billy are very friendly & they make you feel comfortable. Sometimes they have great specials like a beer and a shot for low prices. Also Wednesday night is Trivia Night, it was really fun to play against others and meet new people in the process.

I recommend this bar to anybody who wants a chill, drama- free night.
author: C A.

description: Nice little 'hood bar. Had a pint of Margarita.
author: Maximillian M.

description: The greatest patio! I could sit here all night & let my imagination take me to Alice in Wonderland!
author: Jill B.

description: Great drinks, beautiful patio, and a lovely bartender on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Shalana M.

description: Potent pours!
author: Kevin F.

description: My favorite dive bar in San Francisco!  Pool table, juke box, fun spacious backyard patio and stiff drinks...what more can you ask for?  Oh, and easy to find parking spots.
author: Judith S.

description:
This bar is a boozy paradise all the way out in Bernal Heights.  Living elsewhere in the Bay, I haven't really tried to venture to this neighborhood before recently, which was a MISTAKE!

I came out here to Wild Side West after visiting a friend in the neighborhood, who was selling me on the fact that it's a "divey gay bar with a dragon in a tree!"  (She wasn't lying, but it's also so much more!)

The front room of the bar has some larger, cozy tables, a pool table, juke box-- everything that you need.  The surrounding mix of turn-of-the-century antiques (e.g. Clara Bow-esque black and whites in carved frames) and modern chotchkeys (including a beer-bottlecap-bedazzled pair of mannequin legs spread suggestively over a piano).  It's representative of the folk and the staff who populate the room: familiar, comfortable, respectable, with some edge and flair.

The real unique selling point on this cozy boozy oasis is the back patio/terraced gardens.  This is where the "Dragon in a tree" comes into play:  hodge-podge flower pots, plants, lights, and decor are sprinkled over a top-patio, a lower "lanai," and a terraced garden.  By day, it'd be great to smoke and drink here for hours over a RIchard Brautigan book....and by night it'd be great to smoke and drink here for hours over some good conversation.   A great, unexpected outdoor area to get lost, while you lose yourself in whatever you're doing!  An effervescent womb of flora, light, and cigarette smoke!

Our bartender, Mr. Nancy, was quality people--had to mention that.  

I'm lucky to now have an excuse to come out here and hang (my friend had better never move), but, city folk, if you need a BART-accessible escape without crossing any water or suburbs, I still recommend coming here just to spend a few cozy, smoky hours just outside the trendy hub of the SF metro.
author: Sam R.

description:
Loves this place.  Cool.  fun.  great outdoor area.  and free drinks for sexy me.....  hayyyy!!

xo

P
author: Pammy S.

description: Wild Side West is a serene space in the city. This is a great bar to come to and relax. I really enjoy sitting in the backyard on a nice day.
author: Pillowsblanket S.

description: This bar is so amazing... EXCEPT for the bartender. she is so unbelievably rude. For the first couple of time I came in I thought no big deal, she's just having a bad night. NO. every single time I have come in she has the same rude expression along with no "thank you" or "you're welcome" or even a smile. I have even watched for afar to make sure I'm not being crazy.. She is rude to every single person. Completely uncalled for.
author: Morgan H.

description: Hands down, coolest bar I've ever been to. Like other reviewers have said - you just have to go and experience it. When you walk in get a drink and go straight out the back door, down the stairs, and then explore the garden. You'll find a nice little place to sit and take in all the random decorations. It was pretty quiet when I went but that was nice because I could actually hear the person I was talking to, unlike most bars.
author: Kasey F.

description:
After an epic fail at the club I whipped out Yelp mobile and pulled up this little gem for our party completely due to Mike D.'s fantabulous review.

A lesbian bar with a beer garden, a pool table, and a pinball machine? Okay he had me with just pinball.

This is a great bar. Maybe it was just the culture shock of going from an overcrowded club to a smaller venue. But really nothing to dislike here. I guess the best way to describe this place is it just feels like SF. Just a nice vibe and good peoples.

The only downside to the evening was when we lost our dates to a group of girls who were having a lot of fun. It is a good story, but those darn Yelp rules prevent me from sharing it in this review!
author: Nick B.

description: the only lesbian bar left seince the lexington club closed, men are in here too, its a bar
author: Leigh G.

description: Love this place.  Obviously a neighbourhood bar with lots of regulars, but very welcoming to visitors.  Everyone was so friendly and on a sunny afternoon, discovering the garden, I thought I was in paradise!  This place is now on my list of all time favourite drinking places.  Well worth the walk up the hill.
author: Sarah S.

description:
If I lived nearby, I'd be here all the time.  Amazing outdoor patio with tons of seating, lots of little nooks for hanging out with friends.  I love that there are so many little tabled seating areas behind foliage or trellises -- it keeps the noise down, and it's nice to chat with friends without having the whole bar listening in to your conversation.  Only wish they could keep the yard open later, but understand they've got to be courteous to their neighbors!  Inside is a bit cramped, but fine - your standard neighborhood bar.   Go earlier in the evening, in good weather, to take advantage of the patio.

What is there to say about the bar itself? It's fine... reasonable drink prices, mixed drink specials are usually fairly tasty/strong.   Can't find a thing to complain about. :)
author: Heidi M.

description:
Ah, yes, the Wild Side West.  : )

   The beating, drinking heart of Bernal Heights, the Wild Side West is a seriously funktastic place of wonder that never fails to satisfy.  Unless, of course, you are a straight guy trying to meet a straight girl, cause this place is also the beating heart of SF lesbian drinking culture  (yeah yeah, lexington, whateves) and your Game prolly won't pull much weight here.  (Not to say it is impossible to meet straight women here, it is just statistically less likely.)  

    Anyhoo, the most fabulous thing about the WSW (aside from the killer people, hi Jan!) is the beer garden, which is out back and DOWN THE STAIRS.  Musicians often jam out under the big upstairs patio (you may find me here on occation), and the sprawling beer garden fills the back space with what seems to be 100's of little nooks and grottoes for private conversation.

    The jukebox, which used to play a strict rotation of Janis, Eminem, and Missy Elliot has been updated to one of the internet equiped everysongintheknownuniverse kind of deals, which is cool.  Much cooler than Janis, sorry to say, but hey, to each their own.

  Speaking of Janis, she had sex on the pool table.   True Fact!

  Fireplace:  so so good on those cold San Francisco days and nights in the winter.  And the summer.  and the spring.  And the fall.

   Some of the bartenders are cooler than others.  Mister Nancy is a personal favorite, but a few of the other good ones were sacked/left when the place changed hands recently.  Thus the 4 stars and not 5.  Love this place, can't say I am much for the new management.  BUT... they do care about the place in their own  way and didn't sell the place for scrap wood and condos when SF lesbian icon/bar owner Pat passed away recently.  I do have to say that painting over  the mural on the back wall was a major fuck-up.  Billie... WTF?

   On a historical note, it is important to recognize that 30-40 years ago, lesbians were marginalized and maligned to an even greater extent than gay men, and that Pat and her partner Nancy put their necks on the line and their hearts and souls into a safe, positive place for lesbian women, by lesbian women.  This place drew all kinds of fire from  bigots for many years, and the big front windows were broken so many times by haters that they were eventually just covered up, and remain so to this day.   The Wild Side West is not just a great neighborhood bar, but it is the heart of a community and really represents the best of the spirit which has made San Francisco what it is today.
author: Bad Y.

description:
I had forgotten what a cozy and comforting place the Wild Side is. Last night was a slow Wednesday, and WSW provided a great place to catch up with an old friend, with another old friend tending bar. 

Good beers on tap. Pool. Fire. Outdoors. Juke. Perfect.

Don't get over to Bernal too often but the Wild Side is worth a detour any night or day.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: I'm not too crazy about the TVs inside, but love the backyard patio.  The $4 beer didn't hurt going down either.
author: Maria A.

description: Stopped in for a beer on a nice afternoon with 3 friends, experienced the rudest service from the moment we walked in. We were quiet, respectful, and completely sober, and the bartender gave the rudest looks, scoffing at the one younger girl (22), and not offering any drinks. Regardless, we all tipped well normally-- (hey, people have bad days and don't always need to be nice). I have never made a yelp review, nor wanted to, but as someone that works in the bar and restaurant industry I was blown away. We left after one beer, and while smiling, waving, and saying thank you, she ROLLED HER EYES. My friends and I frequent dive bars and I want expecting anything beyond a beer and a welcomed seat in an COMPLETELY EMPTY BAR.
author: John H.

description: Congratulations it's you first time at a Gay Bar!!!!!!!!!! This is what Foursquare told me WOOHOOOO I LGBT divirginized my social media apps. Anywho this place is pretty trippy, their garden is taken straight out of a bad trip to Alice in Wonderland and if you love hanging out in a swampy mystical environment YOU'LL LOVE IT! Garden Gnomes... Check, Crystal Ball... Check, Dragons...Check, Oversize Frogs staring at you from the trees...Check. I'm a Bernal Local so I come here often, it's always a diff crowd, young, old, sloppy, put together etc etc, you name it this garden might potentially have it. It has us for sure.
author: Lannette G.

description: Why haven't I been here yet? Lived in the city for almost 13 years and finally set foot here the last two Sundays. Loveliest backyard ever, super chill clientele and bartenders. One thing missing, better beer selection on tap but they have a decent happy hour. They have a tasty margarita too. You can bring in food from across the street and enjoy your tasty tuna sammich out in the back. Wonderful!
author: Gina R.

description:
The thing that sets Wild Side West apart is the big beer garden in the back and the cool collection of tunes and pool table in the front.  

The beer garden is awesome for so many reasons.  It's big and has lots of little nooks and crannies for groups to assemble and have some intimacy.  Christmas lights, statues and little waterfalls create a pretty romantic ambience.  

The inside isn't too bad either, as previously mentioned, the jukebox has ample tunes for your listening pleasure and there's a pool table for the folks that need a little activity.  

I'm definitely returning to this bar when the weather gets a bit nicer so I can enjoy the great patio.
author: Karen N.

description: Pilsner Urquell on tap and hefty shots of Irish Whisky...what could be wrong?  Bad service and an uncomfortable atmosphere!  Been there twice and both times was ignored at the bar for a long time before Ms. Surly acknowledged my existence and took my order. She did pour a good sized shot tho. The local hipster dude and his girlfriend were greeted with a smile, and so were the group of girls. I had heard its a lesbian bar, so what?  I wasn't there to chase girls-just wanted a quiet drink.  But it was clear I was not welcome. I get better service and feel way more valued at Sam Jordan's down in Bayview, and I'm REALLY out of place there...  So for Wild Side - probably a great place if you are a local, a hipster or a sensible shoes kind of girl... For the rest of us, just walk across the street to the Horseshoe...
author: Ken P.

description: You don't expect to find a lesbian bar in Bernal Heights but there it was.  Lexington is another.  I am not sure how I just happen into these places.  Good for people watching.  No Pisco though!
author: Laurence H.

description: The place is looks like any dive bar one inside. The backyard area is pretty spacious and is decorated with some crazy stuff. It has benches and tables around spread around along with some nice bushes. The atmosphere is pretty chill.
author: Rigel A.

description:
Cheap drinks.  Not so friendly staff.  Tiny bathroom.

I came here to meet up with some people who were getting together for a drink after work on someone's last day.  It's a block away from where they all work, so the venue was chosen for convenience.

I really didn't like it much here.  When you walk in you notice an odd smell in the place.  Not quite BAD, but very distracting.  Kinduv an "old" smell.

I sat down at the bar and waited for the bartender to serve me.  Now, I do know that this is a lesbian bar, and I didn't feel quite welcome here as a straight guy.  Maybe Im imagining that, but if it wasn't because of my sexual preference, there was definitely some reason why the bartender wasn't very friendly towards me.  She smiled and talked with other patrons that were either regulars, friends, or both, but wasn't nearly as friendly with me.

I tried to order a mojito because I had read on Yelp they were great here, but I was told they were out of mint.  I asked the bartender if she had any other specialties, and she said she could make what tasted kinduv like an alcoholic Snapple.  That sounded awesome, and I went for it.  It was exactly as it was described, and was refreshing and delicious, not to mention strong.  I was very polite the whole time, and even attempted to compliment the bartender on the drink, but just got a weak thanks without her even looking up at me. 

Later when I wanted to play a game of pool, I waited around the bar a bit to ask the bartender for some change.  After a while, she stopped where I was standing and looked at me with a questioning expression, and I asked for change, with a please, and when she gave it to me a thank you.  The whole time she didn't say a single word or crack any semblance of a smile, only acknowledging the whole transaction by giving me what I asked for.

The bathrooms here are two tiny stalls out back, mens and womens next to each other.  Kinda uncomfy.  I had to step in on the side of the toilet in order to open and close the door.  I'm sure it must get difficult for people that are drunk to get in and out.

The patrons here seemed nice enough, but the bartender made me feel very uncomfortable.  Maybe knowing its a lesbian bar is making me confuse being unwelcome because of sexual preference with just plain bad customer service, I don't know.  I doubt I will ever be back.
author: Jon B.

description:
4.5 stars. 

This somewhat clubby dive-ish bar is frequented by a mixture of locals, lesbians, and lesbian locals. It's almost always quiet enough for relaxed conversation (exception being major sporting events). 

There is a huge overgrown garden backyard with seating nooks which is totally awesome when the weather permits.

The first time you walk in you'll immediately feel like you're missing the secret handshake, but that'll pass quickly if you're reasonably polite and civilized.

Whether WSW seems like a lesbian bar or a neighborhood bar varies depending on the day and hour. Straight guys are a common sight although this is probably not the best place in town to hang out in hopes of meeting a single straight girl.

The "competing" bars across the street really don't do anything for me but I do dig WSW.
author: Joseph H.

description:
I had an interesting experience at this bar.  While I went there with the intention of hanging at a bar with hot girls nearer my own age than I could find at the Lex - what ended up happening was that I was maybe one of five or six queer women in a bar that was hoppin' with SF yuppies.

Weird.

But: I do love this bar.  The old-timey dive-ness of it is friggin' awesome.  Their back patios and gardens are really awesomely pretty (though they close at 11pm, which is a bummer).  The bartenders are hot, nice and good at conversation... not to mention they give you free chips occasionally if you have been sitting there long enough...

And, then there was Ms. Claire - whom my friend Liz and I had the great pleasure of talking with for the majority of the evening.  We discussed queer politics, art, lit, music, people being too obsessed with cell phones and computers and the rarity of true love...

Between Amaris, Ms. Nancy and Claire the evening - while not what we had expected - ended up being pretty awesome...

Good stuff, Wild Side West.  Next time I'll wear my bedazzled cowboy hat... Yee-haw, Towanda Jane!
author: Kate R.

description:
Awesome people, rad decor, incredible backyard, Janis Joplin's pool table. 'nuff said.

I only wish this place were in my neighborhood.
author: Emily P.

description:
I consulted Yelp for a neighborhood bar with a patio when a friend of ours wanted to meet up and grab drinks on a lazy Sunday afternoon. It led us to Wild Side West, and as we approached the entrance, we knew we were in for a treat. One of the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence was sitting there, collecting donations for breast cancer. 

Inside, the DJ was mixing some fun dance music. The bartenders were friendly, and because of the breast cancer benefit, felt boobies of the chocolate and vanilla variety were for sale. Imagine walking up to bar and finding a random felt boobie on the bar while you decide what to order. OR being greeted by the bartender's felt boobie, strategically placed between her two real ones.

With several drinks in hand, we headed down the narrow steps to the backyard. Lots of nooks, crannies, and seating - plenty of space to just hang out. Seems to be a chill neighborhood bar, so we'll definitely be back. I'm holding onto that fifth star for subsequent visits!
author: Tinna H.

description:
I was there once, and although I didn't buy a lot of drinks to really know prices, etc. it was an interesting little location to hang out with gay-friendly people.  I remember there are a lot of places around there too to get food etc. when you're buzzed and needing food

PS I don't really like the atmosphere as a gay bar.  Being queer, I didn't find it very inviting in that sense; it just seemed like it just so happened there were a few gays in that place, not that it was specifically a gay location.  The bathroom was really small too.
author: Xhris C.

description:
I love me a lesbian dive bar. Great backyard on this one. It's a trek, for sure, from Petaluma to Bernal Heights, but definitely one I'll make again. Cheap pool table, HD TV, friendly bar tender.

I can't wait to return.
author: David K.

description:
Drinks = good and strong

Ambience = energetic yet laid-back

Bartenders = great, friendly!  

Parking = pain

Outside seating = a nice plus
Although the stairs are treacherous, especially if you're in heels...you've been warned!

Prices = typical, and I think it was cash only...

It's a bar, so it will get crowded!
author: Fannie S.

description:
Last time I was at Wild Side West, I couldn't help but think to myself:  "Nothing like walking into a lesbian bar and finding it full of men...."

Evidently, all walks of life enjoy this saloon.  The very first time I went into Wild Side West I was a lesbian-bar-virgin and didn't have clue.  The late 1800s nudes that adorn the walls got me up to speed pretty quick.  The owner gave me a brief tour, rightfully proud of the lovely garden in the back.  These days, while drinks are mixed by the bundle of energy that is the day bartender, I play a little pinball, or attempt a bit of Burt Bacharach on the upright piano.  At this bar I've engaged in thoughtful political discussions with other patrons, watched one entertaining geriatric pool game, and caught an ep of The Barefoot Contessa on the flat screen.  Very uncomplicated and relaxing.  Best of the Heights.
author: Poet D.

description: Love being in this city full time again as of two months ago!! I'm so happy to find places like this. They just do not exist in LA. Great people, great mixed crowd of all types. Lotsa fun, fun fun! We, my girlfriend and I, are coming back!!
author: Valerie D.

description: This place is extremely nice but I only gave it one star because of Tina the bartender. She lack personality and customer service. My friends told my girlfriend and I to meet them there before we go to dinner at Vega (excellent service and delicious food). So I went to purchase a drink for my girlfriend and I and she ask for my ID which is fine and ask me for the other ID whom I'm buying the drink for. I didn't have any problem with that but I knew it was going to be a problem because of the malicious stare when entering the bar and showing her my ID. My girlfriend shows her ID which is unfortunately expired. I understand by law that an expired ID is not valid. I told her ok but she continue to talk and was very condescending about it. She told my girlfriend that she can't stay because they do not serve food and again gave us a malicious stare of disgust. I didn't want to make a scene so my girlfriend  left and I went to the patio to let my friends know and they were furious because they didn't even get carded. So they decided to test it out to see if we were getting discriminated against because we were of African Descent or lesbian. My friend (Caucasian male) went to order a drink to see if he would be treated differently. Of course he was, so she wasn't just following the  law... She wanted us out of there. She didn't ask for his ID nor ask for the person of whom he is buying the drink for. At that moment I was furious but walked out because I'm not a confrontational person. I live close to the neighborhood, we did not present ourselves as if we were trouble. I have never experience such blatant racism in my life and this will not be my last review or action. San Francisco is a city full of different people and I don't want anyone to feel the way my girlfriend and I felt.
author: Shay B.

description:
Go for the enchanting back patio filled with huge windchimes, creepy maniquins, old porch swings and large, stone frogs. 
You can catch the sunset and have a drink and it is so dang magical.
author: Addyline L.

description: This is technically a lesbian bar, but in reality it's an pretentious hipster bar (no that's not an oxymoron). It's really a neat little place with great knick-knacks (think Sweeney Todd barber chair), an extensive music collection, a fireplace, fun elixirs (i.e. chocolate cake shot, hot buttered rum), and a great vibe overall.
author: Andrew K.

description: niner/giants fans without question! awesomely eclectic patio, garden, and deck. free food sometimes-- i love their chili competition and stiff cheap drinks. perfect for day drinking and relaxing with the game on. easy parking, nice crowd mix, dogs allowed. perfect neighborhood bar. love this place.
author: Vanessa D.

description: The garden alone is well worthwhile, add good company, and the drinks are always good!
author: Tiia M.

description: What a cool bar! the large three story garden in the back where the saying among the locals is 'smoke whatever you want, no one cares' is awesome. I love drinking my cocktails out by the exotic plant life the owners have growing back there. The bar has been there for ages and it gives off this old timey welcome home feeling. On cold days they have the wood burning fireplace on. And, if you want to make a night of it, the most amazing sushi place is across the street named Mokis, make a reservation because the fish is fresh and the place is usually full. After dinner wonder over to the art gallery 'Inclusions' which is about a block away.
author: Zoe Z.

description: I went bar hopping last night and had a great time at Wild Side.  They have an outdoor patio area which was so nice and chill.  On a beautiful day or night I could hang out there all day / night long drinking and smoking.  Bartenders were also very nice.  This is a great neighborhood bar!
author: Elena N.

description: I like to this of Wild Side West as a local bar for everyone that leans towards being a lesbian bar.  Everyone is welcome as long as you are not a jerk.  Also, they have the best beer garden in town.  It is overgrown, and has little secluded areas, and fairy lights, and found "art," and I want to spend all my days in it.
author: Tia B.

description: My favorite bar in bernal heights, well there are only maybe 2 bars there ha. I love the cute patio on the back, feels like home! Cool unique things to look at and cozy atmosphere.
author: Karen T.

description: Wild Side West is fantastic.  As Bernal residents, we actually have some pretty great choices for bars, but the Wild Side stands out.  Bartenders are mostly friendly enough, the beer selection is fine, and the prices are reasonable.  But it's a tie for the main attractions - the garden out back or the clientele.  The garden is funky in a really wonderful SF way, and the perfect spot to hang out on a warm afternoon or night.  There's always somebody playing music and lots of great plants and weird garden ornaments.  The clientele is always friendly, often quite drunk, and widely varied.  I do wish they'd change up the beer selection a bit more, and with a bit of cleaning up the main room could be made a bit more comfortable.
author: Chris B.

description:
It's hard to go near Bernal Heights and not stop in Wild SIde West. Be careful of the Mint Juleps, they are tall and might knock you down....
As the pictures reveal, the garden/sitting area in back is charming and a really nice place to be on a warm evening.

The bartenders have always been pleasant and the atmosphere has always been very relaxed in a cute and campy sort of way. 
Nicely done.
author: Bella T.

description:
Love this spot!!! Even more so now that the sun is showing it's face again 'round these parts.... making it an oh so lovely idea to be outside more...morning,  noon and night!!! Besides being a fun little bar with a rockin' jukebox (a crony told me it's now one of those fancy shmancy satellite jukes) the bartenders are mostly awesome (there a couple of standoffish ones that will give you the stink eye the first 2-3 times you go then it's all good and they will make your drinks EXTRA (tres boozy) yummy!! Kat is the bomb!!! Tina F (we miss you!!) Anyway, a very stellar crew, mixed clientele although the Wild Side is officially a ladies who like ladies bar! One of the first actually, in SF! 

Wild Side has been in Bernal for 30+ years now! When it first opened (by Nancy and Pat) patrons would frequently find themselves getting hassled/heckled and a couple times a month the owners would find their front windows smashed in!!! The solution? Stop replacing 'em! Which is why even to this day, there are no front windows, artfully boarded up you could say...with just a friendly swingin' door (that goes both ways) to welcome you! CAUTION: Don't go bustin' in the front door too quickly, or you may hit the backside of one of the folks playing pool! (I've been on both sides of the equation and depending on your level of inebriation can alternately be hilarious or obnoxious...you've been warned and besides, you don't want to start off on the wrong foot now, do you? Of course not!!! = ) 

Ahem, so this place has a pool table, great juke, fun bartenders, a diverse clientele that is there to have a blast...what else?? So glad you asked! This place has the...BEST...backyard I have ever experienced at a bar!! Better than your Uncle Bob's patio, better than many beer gardens in Munich...this here patio/yard has like...4-5 levels??? You walk out the back door and you're on a cool deck with a few seats...you go down a couple of steps and there's a nifty nook with a table and 5-6 chairs and a bench...trot down a few more steps...green trees, flowering bushes and a cozy seating area for 4 ...a little gazebo and swing and miscellaneous chairs...journey further and there's a stretch of lawn, more trees for lounging and lollygagging about on the lawn or chairs...it's really cool if you want to get some fresh air, smoke, plot a coup, make out or swap stock tips or recipes!!! AND this place has some pretty swell bbq's during football season!!! If bbq isn't your thing, you're easy walking distance from great restaurants....Vino Rosso, Liberty Cafe, Little Nepal, Piqueo's, Moki's to name a few! 

On 2nd thought, forget what I said, it's really not that great here (hoping that the place won't be inundated with people...I like to think of it as perk of hanging in Bernal and being in the know!!! (~_~)   Alright, just kidding...stop on by and..... 

......."Take a walk on the wild side!!"  (Where's a clip of Lou Reed singing when you need one? = )
author: Karen S.

description:
Looking for a place with a nice big back patio area, is low key and chill and away from all the noise of the city?  Wild Side West is really great for that.

There's a mixed crowd here and even though it's in Bernal it's not just a Bernal crowd but folks from all over.  If it's nice out (or even our usual chilly weather), you have to go out back on the deck or yard.

Everyone seems to leave everyone else alone here and there's no pretense here at all...
author: Gene X.

description:
This is my favorite bar in the entire city. The staff are fantastic, from remembering everyone's name, to knowing when I had just had my heart broken to remembering my favorite drinks. It is how your drinking experience SHOULD be.

Lovely lesbians, cute nerdy nonscene gay guys...awesome neighborhood straight people and the best jukebox in town.

They have hot alcoholic beverages in the winter, a gorgeous outdoor seating area year round, and irish food on St. Patty's Day.

You could not go to a better place, so tell Tyr, Regina, and Mr Nancy that Rylan sent you ;)
author: Rylan S.

description:
I like this place enough - it has a nice backyard.

But sometimes you never know what you're going to get here. I went here for my birthday last year and some creeper of a dude kept hitting on me and my roommate.

And I'm knocking off a star for the red-headed bartender who never ceases to be a rude ass bitch.
author: Whitney D.

description: It's like a really weird run down neighborhood bar from Wisconsin but with lots of lesbians and trees. Perfect little nooks and crannys behind trees and bushes to escape reality with some beers. I dig this place a lot, but some of the bartenders are ice queens. Just accept them for who they are and they will serve you a good drink. We can't all be sunny.
author: Jackie S.

description:
This bar is almost a lot of things;

It is almost a lesbian bar, but there are always enough straight people here to make you unsure

It is almost a neighborhood bar but there are enough people here who have clearly traveled from other corners of the city

It is almost a dive bar but the percent of its clientele that are career drinkers is not high enough

It almost provides great service, except when it doesn't

It is almost a good deal...the drinks are very strong, but a tad too expensive

It is almost a great place to hang out on a sunny day but there is seldom a steady stream of sunshine on their multi-level back patio

It has almost  all of the things you want in terms of entertainment and ambiance; a pool table, a fireplace, a decent jukebox, old school cash register, kitchy decor and pinball, but people seldom utilize all of this to its full potential

Despite it being an "almost" bar (I didn't even know this sort of bar existed until  started writing this review) it is still a great place in Bernal Heights to hang to with a few friends and quench your thirst. 

Definitely worth checking out. 

I am almost sure you will like it as much as I do.
author: Drue C.

description:
Yeah.  Uhm.  So I've been holding out on you.  I know, you thought that since I'd been so opinionated... so caustic... you thought that meant I was an open book, so of course I'd already told you about my favorite place.  I'm SO sorry but I just couldn't.  I'm a conflicted Yelper with trust issues.  Let's start with:

1) I don't know you.  What if you're actually some chest bumper with frat manners?  I can just hear you yelling backward as the lesbian bouncer hauls you out, "DUUUUUUDE!  Rosie W. said this place was cool!"  Which leads me to:

2) They know me here.  OK, not THAT well, but Regina knows me.  And she's pretty much the most professional, friendly booze ninja in this whole city.  If you ruin that for me, I will be a sober nomad with nowhere to go.  Which brings me to:

3) I live crawling distance from this place.  It is my Regal Beagle.  And when I'm here, I really can't talk to you.  Because I am probably already drunk and boring the life out of some poor young lesbian who just got off the bus from Eugene and wanted to have some fun but now is stuck in a dead end conversation with a married chick.  So you see, I am busy.  Which brings me to:

4) This is a lesbian bar.  That doesn't mean it's only for lesbians.  That means if you get into an argument with a lesbian here, you lose.  So you can hang out, but you are a guest and need to mind your ass.  Which leads me to:

5) There's not a lot of room on the patio.  This patio has been the fertile ground of many a fruitful conversation with my neighbors.  It's my salon.  My Algonquin Round Table.  OK, sometimes it's just where I chain smoke and repeat myself (see #3).  But there's not a lot of room and it's one of very few al fresco drinking spots in town with a wind guard.  

I want this to work SO badly.  So let's just agree that you won't thrust the door open and screw up someone's pool game, and you will say please and thank you and be friendly, and you will not hog the spots in front of the fireplace or on the patio.  And you will never, ever put your cigarette out in the typewriter.  

OK, we have a deal.
author: Rosie W.

description:
An entertaining place to come for a drink with a friend. Lots of colorful people here (and not just lesbians).

The beers appear to be relatively cheap.

Not my usual cup of tea, but if I'm in the neighborhood, I'll happily come here.
author: Dana L.

description:
Every month or so, I pick an SF neighborhood I know very little about and just start walking.  I always do this alone because I'm a rebel. Or because no one can stand my company, but that's a story for another review. This past Sunday, Bernal Heights was my chosen destination.

If you can get past the Mt. Kilamanjaro walk up Cortland Avenue from Mission Street, I guarantee you will find something here to suit your taste. A Cambodian restaurant? That's odd. Jesus Christ, there are a lot of dogs in this neighborhood; Michael Vick would love it here (just kidding). Wow, this video store (http://www.yelp.com/biz/CSdlg3J_lhtN_TRlB9BjiA) has almost everything from the Criterion Collection. I'll definitely come back here to get my Jane Campion on...that bitch can direct!!

Best of all, Bernal Heights is home to Wild Side West. I sat at the bar and struck up a conversation with two SF locals who invited me to join their group on the back patio. Have you been back there at night?? It's an OASIS! An OASIS of AWESOME! It's a little tricky traversing the stairs after 3 pear ciders though, so be careful.

5 Stars.

Note: My only complaint is that the jukebox sure does carry a lot of Indigo Girls and KD Lang tunes.  I guess the owners really enjoy country western/folk music. That's the only explanation I can think of anyway.
author: John T.

description:
Heavy pours, lots of lesbians, and decor that looks like a musty attic (and also my dream living room.) If somebody threw Dire Straits' Money for Nothing on the CD player, it would be just like childhood. And lord knows the best bars remind you of childhood.

Also, they let me put my own honey in the hot toddy, which is about the best thing any bartender has ever done for me. After all, I'm an adult now; I can have as much honey as I want.
author: Megan W.

description:
This is a charming little hole in the wall of a bar. I like that it looks kind of like a haunted house/old western style featuring real dust and cobwebs. It reminds me of what a real western bar would have been like back in the 1850's sans all of the electronics, fancy beer taps and other modern conveniences (Insert internal running water here).

The back yard is accommodating offering seating with privacy for 2 people all the way to large groups.

Good place to lounge around, I feel that for a dive bar that I'd normally rate at a 2 stars this one is a little more special than most.
author: Carlos V.

description:
The first time I went to this bar I was meeting someone and was fairly new to Bernal Heights. So as I sat there patiently waiting and drinking I thought to myself, "Man, there's a lot chicks in this place." I don't recall exactly, but I may have been the only dude there. /Stage whisper/ "The Wild Side is a lesbian bar!"

That's cool. I've been back many times and have never gotten a man-hater vibe and there's actually a pretty mixed crowd. There's a pool table, a patio out back and a grandma's attic/lumberjack decor. Friendly laid back atmosphere. 

The Wild Side West, where you don't need to be lesbian to have fun, but it'd be more fun if you were.
author: Josua P.

description:
This place is perfect for an event or large party. 
I was recently here for the Benefit for the Boob.
