Lots of really cool people and entertainment. 
Plus they have a lovely patio and backyard. 
Bartenders are a friendly bunch.
A destination place for a warm sunny day.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Okay, before I continue on with my reviews of Chicago establishments, I had to write a quick review for Wild Side West since I paid this awesome place a visit last night with a couple of friends.  

Wild Side West is the ish, yo!  Seriously, the bartenders are awesome.  The people are friendly and it totally beats the Lex, by far!  My friend bar tends there and I actually ran into her and it was so nice to feel welcome.  My friend and her girlfriend had an equally great experience because the entire vibe was incredibly chill.  

The coolest part is that they don't give anyone problems, which is so great.  They've got a nice little patio out back with benches and the cutest dangling lights for ambiance.  Seriously, it's one of the best bars I've been too with a completely chill vibe.
author: Dorothy S.

description:
This bar has a great back yard and cool atmosphere.  I wish I could go there again but the staff was so unbelievably rude that I have to give it one star.  

I went there on a week night with a friend.  When we got there and ordered a drink there were 3 people behind the bar but only one person doing anything and we were ignored for several minutes.  I was a little annoyed but I thought "hey, it's a week night, everyone seems to be in a good mood, I'll roll with it".  

My friend and I finally got our beers and went out back to drink.   A while later the bar tender came by and told us to bring our own glasses back up since we were such jerks....WTF???  I asked her what she was talking about and she laid into us about how we were so rude when we were waiting for our drinks.  Neither us us had any idea what she was talking about.  She thought we had complained about waiting so long (obviously she realized we had and felt sensitive about it).  

The only thing we could figure out was that we had been talking about a race my friend was going to run and she somehow pickup up "it's about time" as complaining to her.

In any case, nothing we said made any difference to her or anyone else working at the bar.  As local customers clearly we were wrong and not worth listening to.

So if you go to this place, make sure you kiss the staff's butt or you may find yourself being attacked.
author: Keith B.

description:
OK, call me a hater, but I have to say it...  I love a dive bar and especially love a gay dive bar.  I really, really want to love the WWW.  It's nearby, it's kitschy, it's neighborhood-ish and queer-friendly.  You can bring a group of folks here and get spots at the pool table pretty quickly, your songs come up on the jukebox in a reasonable amount of time, and there's a backyard and a fireplace.  

But there's just something that's a little off.  Maybe it's the fact that you have to wait forever to get a drink from the surly chick behind the bar.  Maybe it's that the drinks should be just a titch cheaper for the venue.  Maybe it's the rats in the backyard.  I can't say. 

I'll go here if you're buying the first and second rounds or I haven't seen you in a while.  Or if it's a sunny weekend afternoon.  Otherwise, let's go somewhere else.
author: Andi T.

description: This is a good friendly neighborhood bar.  Cheap beer and good service in an environment where you can sit and talk to your friends.  They also have sports or an awesome movie on in the background if you get bored of your friends.
author: Paul T.

description: This is friendly neighborhood bar which has a very comfortable atmosphere which borders on being almost a cluttered mess - I was there on a cold overcast day and so you couldn't really use their outdoor space.  I've been told by friends when the weather is nice this is a great place to hang out with friends and have some beers.  Looking forward to a return trip on a sunny afternoon..  Great selection of beers, and great mixed drinks (strong).
author: Kevin G.

description:
I wish I was just a little bit better with my bike.

I wish riding up to the top of Cortland were a casual thing, a "Oh, you know- just rode up Cortland... what're you up to?" kind of thing. If it were, I would do all my studying and homework in the back yard of Wild Side West. It feels like someone took my favorite stuff about Texas backyards (minus the barbeque), and moved it to San Francisco. And then offered me a beer.

I heart WWS forever.
author: jason l.

description:
Gorgeous. 
Simply because it attracts the most laid-back honest mix of unpretentious folks in the city. The Fireplace is laden with shoes and there's always someone playing a not-so serious round of pool. Drinks are cheap and standard. But the real magic happens out on the back patio. Someone's always strumming a guitar, lighting a cigarette, telling a story. It's sunny during the day and lit with twinkling lights at night. Everybody I've taken here loves it--yes even straight guys AND lesbians. How many places can you say that about? This is my current favorite bar in the city.
author: Sita B.

description:
I love the outside patio. It's such a contrast to the bar...with rambling vines and cozy little tables. Inside is laid back random funky with flashbacks to the 70s (and before) here and there. 

Haven't been there in a while, but the last couple times I went the bartender was friendly (and cute), the company was friendly (and cute), and I felt relaxed and happy with my honey (who is, again, friendly and cute). 

Good place for a kick-back time.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
We decided to go here because a lesbian friend of mine was in town and she wanted to see a little of the SF lesbian scene.  This was our third stop on our LGBT SF tour for her.  And by far, the most action was happening here on a Saturday night.  It was cozy and inviting.    

So we walked in and the gal at the pool table seemed friendly, really friendly.  I think she was a regular.  We saw her kissing another woman about half an hour later.  Then my friend decided that she wanted to send a photo of herself kissing a woman to her girlfriend back home.  So she was making out at the bar with this same pool table woman and snapping a photo with her phone.  Hey, whatever turns you on, right? 

There definitely seemed to be some affection goin' on in this place.  So, I would say that if you are a lesbian, or bi-curious even, you have a good chance of getting some action at this place.  Or at least getting a date.

I really liked the fireplace with shoes on it.

It is fine to go into this place as a heterosexual couple.  Though guys might be a little jealous of (or maybe turned on by?) their girlfriends getting all the attention from other women.  

Enjoy the people watching!
author: Erica H.

description:
Wild Side West is, by far, the best place to drink outside in San Francisco. Their back patio is a little hetero-friendly lesbian wonderland in my sunny neighborhood. It is absolutely perfect!

As far as the inside goes, it's getting a little too smelly. Husband and I walked by last night and there was a curious smell emanating from inside. I don't know, it was like a combo of booze-soaked floor, backed up toilet, and bleach. Not good. Even still, that back patio is amazing. I'll take it over Zeitgeist any day!
author: Abby W.

description: Best outdoor patio in San Francisco.  Good beer, better mixed drinks.  Great neighborhood dyke bar with a nice crowd.
author: X-topher B.

description:
It's a shame I don't remember that this place is here more often. Because I live up on Bernal Hill, I'm often reluctant to go anywhere because it can be simply discouraging to think of walking back up the hill or paying a cab to lift me 300 vertical feet. But Wild Side West, despite some hills and valleys on the route, is more or less at the same altitude in my house. What's not to love? 

They've got a great outdoor area and despite an apparent classification as a gay bar, I've always felt welcome (as opposed to, say, the Lexington Club). Decent beer selection and always a fun time, and I need to remember to support my local watering hole more often.
author: Ian M.

description:
This is in response to a review written about me that Colleen wrote.  Love my job. Love my regulars who have been great to me.  Love the Wild Side West.  You on the other hand, I think are ruminating tooo much on one thing I said which you completely took the WRONG way.  When you ordered your beers and I was running out I ran downstairs and made sure to grab more and chill them on ice for you so your next round would be nice and cold. I actually tried to give your 8 dollar tip back the first round, sure it was a great tip, but if I really cared how much you were tipping I would not try to hand it back to you! I agreed with you that the movie was intense and that I was trying to find something to watch.  When you told me that you were glad I changed the channel I did say something in the vane of ..I'm not changing the fucking channel for you! I am changing it because it needs to be changed!  I swear a lot, YES IT"S TRUE!  And when you pulled me aside one of my regulars stood up for me because he thought you were being hypersensitive.

Notice there are no other bad reviews about me here. I want to defend my honor.  I am a kickass bartender and I like my job and feel lucky to be a part of a great establishment. 

It is really too bad that you misconstrued what I was trying to convey.  Seems like you are looking for something to write down and want to be mad about something...I am not the only one who noticed!
author: anita e.

description:
Around the corner from my house is Wild Side West, a great little lesbian bar (although I think it's really just for everyone).  There's a pool table inside, if you dare to challenge any of the skilled billiard artisans who play there.  After being humiliated and with my tail between my legs, I head out to the Back Garden, down the stairs.

It's divided up into eight or nine seating areas, all divided by mature foliage, and is actually quite beautiful.  Every little area is set up as an intimate place for between 5-8 people to get their swerve on, and I've met some funny and interesting people there.

Go, if even just to see the garden, even if you don't drink, grab a soda water and drink it in down there.  Bring a friend, prepare to bash Republicans, and check it out.
author: Randy F.

description:
After a quick walk through the Mission district and a hike and picnic on Bernal Hill, my friend suggested we check out this little bar he and his girlfriend stumbled upon while exploring a few months back. Wanting to see San Fransisco from a non-tourists perspective we quickly agreed, especially after he assured us it was the chillest bar he had ever been to.

He wasn't lying! Even from the exterior, I knew I was going to like this place. However it wasn't until I stepped inside that I knew it for sure. And of course when I stepped back outside onto the expansive, multi-level patio I was smitten! Oh why can't we have a Wild Side East in Boston! 

Visually its an overload. It's the kind of place where I bet even a regular is discovering some new scrap of paper on the wall or a clay figure poking out from behind a plant on every visit. It looks like a cowgirl's mind exploded. This is also the bar I discovered Speakeasy's Big Daddy IPA (which is delightfully making its way east and can be found in a few packies in Boston), my favorite of the local beers I sampled. Wild Side West was the perfect low-key place to take a break from a lazy Sunday of exploring to hang out and meet some locals, before disembarking to do more of the same.
author: R C.

description: Nice broad selection of beers and drinks -- great garden in the back, nice neighborhood in the city
author: Ed B.

description:
Wild Side West is like the Lexington's quieter, friendlier, and not-nearly-as-horny older sister.

Sure, it's way the hell out there, but its isolation evokes a true neighborhood feel.  Aesthetically and thematically, Wild Side recalls an old country general store.  Some of the bartenders can be a little self-absorbed--a few have ignored my very patient and respectful male friend for minutes on end--but others are completely welcoming.  And the drink selection is fabulous: a good mix of beers and uber-girly elixers.  My favorite is the Peppermint Patty: hot chocolate with a generous helping of Peppermint Schnapps.  

Wild Side West's patrons are remarkably varied.  On any given night you can run into flannel-sporting locals as well as made-up L.A. expatriates.  Some are hot and others aren't, but this isn't a pick-up scene anyway.  

The outdoor patio is beautiful but very, very cold.  I know a lot of small-framed women who would appreciate the addition of a few heat lamps.  

All in all, Wild Side West is a cute, quaint bar and the pride of SF lesbian nightlife.
author: Karin H.

description:
I went to Wild Side West for the first time for my 33rd birthday because I wanted somewhere casual and fun, with an outdoor area. It was the perfect place for my party! 

We got there early enough to grab 2 big tables in the backyard patio, and as my friends trickled in, I started the night with a super-fantastic Mexican Coffee specialty drink (I am a major tequila lover, and there is nothing better than tequila with coffee and kahlua!!). We had pizza delivered from Goat Hill Pizza, and everybody was in heaven!

The cute bartendress (damn, I forget her name!) gave me a free birthday shot of my favorite tequila (and a few of my friends too) later in the evening when we moved inside to warm ourselves up. 

Wild Side West totally rocked my birthday world. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful, the bathrooms were clean, and everyone in the bar, patrons and staff alike, was having a great time. It's not fancy, it's totally low-key and no frills, so if that's what you're looking for, go for it! 

Oh, by the way, it's not a Lesbian/Gay Bar, it's just that some lesbians happen to run it. It's homo-hetero-whatever friendly! Myself and all my friends there that night are almost all 100% hetero, and nothing was amiss.
author: Gael T.

description:
So some people have been comparing this place to Zeitgeist. But it's not a big open rowdy hipster beer garden. A more apt comparison (in terms of vibe and layout) would be El Rio, and Wild Side West wins out on that battle.

Here's why I like Wild Side West best:
1. It's in Bernal Heights, which doesn't get nearly enough love as it deserves (mostly because of its distance from the center of SF, I'd imagine).
2. The beer garden is multi-leveled. Mutli-leveled! I feel like I have stumbled into an Ewok dwelling, but with less fur and more lesbians.
3. There's all sorts of magical hidden art out back. The knight is my favorite. Such a brave little man.
4. Allegedly open jam sessions are a common occurrence in one of the gazebos (wasn't happening when I went though). Bring your own guitar though?
5. There's a real communal neighborhoody vibe amongst the patrons... I felt welcomed immediately.

I mean, I love El Rio too, but Wild Side West is just... special.
author: Trey F.

description: Wow, I was here a month or two ago and haven't had the chance to review. It was a nice Sunday, I wanted to take a couple friends for a drink there to show them the awesome secret garden. I've always loved this bar because everyone's always super nice, drinks are priced well, and the garden is beautiful. Last time I was there we met the owner. She was friendly, a really warm person and the fact shes a dog lover. She played w/ my little yorkie for awhile, he fell in love w her. Oh yea, I'm straight and super girly, still love this bar.
author: Nicole P.

description:
One of my top three bars in the City, and definitely the one w/ the coolest beer garden (#2 El Rio, #3 Zietgeist). The patrons are so diverse you could definitely spend all night here w/o even realizing it's a queer bar.  the highlight of the place is the backyard beer garden.  it's huge, beautiful and decorated with gorgeous plants and lights, and much more pleasant than the beer garden at zietgeist.  wild wide west lacks pretension and yet would be justified in having it.

Wild Side West is a major contender for my favorite bar in SF!

NOTE:  Don't come here if you're looking to hook up or have a wild, crazy night.  This is more of a chill place to come and chat with friends.  If you want to engage in the former activities, go to Hot Pants at Cat Club or Brownies For My Bitches at Harvey's, or Toxic Sunday at the Cafe, etc etc.
author: Sid D.

description:
Looking for a place where you can sit outside in a gorgeous garden and smoke? This is Eden, baby. Beautiful. 

Went here for my friend's birthday. I was apprehensive, at first, because from the outside, it looks small. But don't be fooled by the tiny exterior. There's a LOVELY backyard. And an even lovelier bartender. She's smokin' hot. Had a great time and will definitely be back again!
author: Guinevere Y.

description:
I'm not really sure how I feel about this bar. 

On one hand, it's totally cool with the huge backyard that makes you feel like you're on a jungle adventure.

On the other hand, the bartender (the night I went, anyway) wasn't particularly friendly and didn't really make me want to give her my hard earned money for the overpriced mixed drinks. 

And yet on one hand, many people are nice and will talk to you and try to include you in the group.

But still on the other hand, you might get hit on by straight boys (I did) or get caught talking to weird lesbian couples from Canada that are really boring and socially awkward (that happened too).

Then again on one hand, they've got this group of old hippies that play music outside on certain nights and invite you to jam along with them.

Still on the other hand, you might feel out of place if you don't particularly enjoy these jam sessions and stand there feeling out of place while your other friends join in. 

So WSW is sort of like a Chili's Restaurant. You know you can have a decent time, but there are just enough things to keep you from truly and unabashedly enjoying yourself.
author: Angie B.

description: Average age of the customers here is older than what i would like it to be.  This is a local corner bar, don't expect to see anyone dressed up nice or wearing makeup.  A good place to kick it and you're a lesbian and you live walking distance from the bar.  It looks really old-fashioned inside like a very old bar.  I am sure I could grow to love this bar if I lived near it.  But last night when I went I just wanted to get out of there.  I told my driver James, "Take us to the Lexington James."  Wild Side West, good luck to your business but I probably won't be back until I am desperate and in my 50s.  Generally speaking, the women there were not cute.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Was strolling aimlessly on Cortland Ave, a recent discovery, and passed this place.  Attraction?...Raider of the Lost Ark pinball...hello.

Went with a man friend and had a great time.  The bartenders were awesome...one unfortunate fellow that seemed to think we weren't cool enough for the place, but that's a mark on HIM, not the place.

Beautiful, BEAUTIFUL garden areas.  Just a lovely place, lovely people.
author: Cris C.

description:
Boyfriend: I think this is a lesbian bar.
Me: No, I don't think so.  (Looks around) .... Okay, yeah.  Oops.
author: Helen C.

description:
I don't know why I have never reviewed his place just have not ..

I went last Thurs to play pool though and had such a goodtime decided to yelp about it wanna hear it here it goes

Things we already know
Umm its on cortland
It's a Divebar
Been around forever
1st gay bar on Cortland

Things you may or may not know 

1.Well the friend I went to meet says that she goes because she can always discover a new treasure ( you know some strange lil trailer park artifact)

2. The juke box is crackin and you can even go online and find whatever you want

I actually had hell of fun last week I have a few friends who live in the area so I may just go back more often
author: Kim R.

description:
Holy crap, this place has THE BEST outdoor patio area in all of the places I've been to in SF.

Cute, even kitschy homo bar when you walk in. And its in Bernal Heights, not exactly known for its roaring nightlife (or roaring homos... haha), but this is wonderful place. Reminds of of Truck in SOMA, except more lezzies. The drinks were cheap, delicious, and served with pizazz. I'll be back for sure, don't miss this place gays and non-gays!
author: Rocky K.

description: Ventured to Bernal Heights and walked into this bar a little before midnight on a Saturday night. Found the bar lined with men..possibly two women or so in the whole place. It was not very packed. I was expecting a lesbian bar but quickly left for the lack of women. Possibly the men were lesbians but not quite what I was going for.
author: Blu M.

description:
I can't believe I'm lucky enough to live within walking distance of this bar.  The bartenders here are so sweet and the patrons have all been cool too.

So far my highlights include:
- Sitting down at a table with a random guy in a fedora, and watching my friends try on his hat.
- Guy with banjo and guy with fiddle playing bluegrass covers of Oasis.
- Watching two guys ferociously make out against the back fence of the garden (sorry, but I literally could not look away).
- Walking in on a busy night and finding the bar both crowded and completely silent, staring at the TV.  I was pretty sure the president was speaking or we'd had another terrorist attack, but then I saw Meryl Streep was giving her Golden Globes acceptance speech.  Felt like I was getting the collective stink eye from the room for interrupting.
- Getting a well deserved eye roll from the bartender after my friend and I broke a glass (pro tip: those table tops are NOT fastened to their supports, i.e. milk crates, on the back patio) and then in our drunken state thought it would be a good idea to present her with an ash tray full of broken glass as a "warning" that there was glass downstairs.

I hope to have repeats of these experiences and many new exciting ones, once it's warm enough to sit outside again.

PS - If you sit on my porch swing I will cut you.
author: J W.

description:
What could be better than a cool bar located a 1/2 block from my house!  Great outdoor space with private lounging nooks.  These ladies (I've never seen a male bartender) pour a heck of a drink.  Make sure you eat dinner first!

It's always referred to at a lesbian bar (and actually, I have been picked up a couple of times...) but it is definitely welcoming to everyone.  My husband and I have been coming here for years.

And $.50 pool!  Does it get any better than this?!
author: Heather F.

description:
I went here fully knowing about it being a lesbian bar.  I didn't have a problem getting a drink, the back yard was nice (even though I had to sneak down there because it was late), the pool table was bar-worthy, but the place seemed a little bit dead.  Kind of "meh," if you will.  

If you won't then go ahead and go.  Maybe it was an off night?
author: Brian H.

description:
After a day inclusive of photo taking, driving down every steep street the city could throw my way and going crazy shopping on Valencia, my friend and I decided we were thirsty and the only place which could sate our palates was Wild Side West.

I never knew about the little garden in the back with all its little secluded places to sit and get comfy. It was the bomb!!
I have to say I felt like a complete maroon after all the times I just sat at the bar itself and watched the bartender use the cool old cash register.. but we settled on into the best seat in the house, way in the back and we drank until the cows came home.....great place. I love coming to Bernal and relaxing here with friends.
author: M C.

description: just an average bar. good size pours and a nice patio outside.
author: Priya K.

description:
Shhhhhhh...Okay folks, I know it's hard not to go to the nearest hilltop (Bernal Hill - it's beautiful) and shout at the top of your lungs how much you heart Wild Side West, but please use some discretion. If we are not careful our secret garden could turn into the next Zeitgeist; Bernal Heights would be overrun by fratboys and then us locals would have to go all the way down the hill to El Rio to escape the havoc that would ensue. I hate frat boys and I hate the cover charge at El Rio...so let's keep it on the down low*, alright?

* Okay, I am not that righteous. Please share our jewel with the people you love, but if they are wearing a NOR CAL hoodie (West Coast Choppers is just as offensive) and drive a pick-up truck re-direct them to Zeitgeist
author: Hurricane Rena ..

description: I almost held out on posting a review for this place because this is one of my favorite bars. Why? I grew up in this area, lived about 2 blocks away. This bar from the outside, looks like my old house! But that's besides the point. Plenty of beers on tap, great bartenders, pool table, pinball, juke box, and oh yeah the Secret Garden. I call it the Secret Garden because the moment you walk down the steps of the patio you'll feel like you followed a rabbit into a hole and entered into Wonderland. Not so Secret anymore now that I posted here on Yelp, but it's a must and don't mind sharing at all. Enjoy!
author: Eric D.

description:
In my pre-East Bay life, Wild Side West was my local hangout.  It's lesbian-owned, yes, and many patrons are lesbians, but not in the clique-y hardcore Lexington sort of way, where bio-males or straight chicks are pretty much prohibited unless you're with someone really cool.     

Others have already waxed poetic about the amazing patio, so I'll give you some of the other reasons to put WSW on your favorite bar list:

- It's dark and cozy with a great fireplace if it's too cold to hang out in the garden.

- The bartenders are sweet and edgy at the same time, and they don't play favorites just because they know the person at the end of the bar.

- The walls (and other surfaces) are covered with junk to look at, so if you're shy and you're waiting for someone, you can distract yourself by examining the shoes that cover the fireplace (for example).

- The tonic water tastes really good for some reason, so the well T&Ts taste better here than some of the top-shelf ones I've tasted elsewhere.

- Their softball team has a reputation of being unbeatable when there's beer around; otherwise they kinda suck.
author: Sharon M.

description:
Though you could totally call this a neighborhood 'girl bar' it's not. It's a neighborhood anyones bar that just so happens to have some sexy lesbians..or..a lot of them..((eyes glaze over))....what was I saying? Oh yes...

This is a perfect place to grab a drink and go sit outside. They have it set up all cozy like and I totally dig it...though the night we went we witnessed some sketchy activity but ya know...they weren't bothersome so I don't have much to complain about. If you are a girl..who likes girls..who wants to bring girls or boys - this is a great place to do so. I once stopped in the Lex with 2 boys and..yeah..AWWWWKWWAAARD...
author: Natalie G.

description: Great dive. Funky decorating. Great back deck for smoking conversation. Wonderful beer garden during the day. Show up early (1pm) on a sunny Sunday afternoon and head downstairs for a real good time. Difficult employees are the only drawback.
author: seth c.

description:
One of the best bars to hang out at in the evening during the warm months of September and October. The multi-terraced outdoor patio in the back has plenty of common areas with room for groups up to about 15 if you feel like being social... there's also lots of hidden nooks and crannies if you need an intimate corner for making out. 

The place is decorated with lots of colored lights and strange little statues. There are two propane bbqs which anyone can use if you want to bring some food to have with your cheap drinks. 

On some weekend nights, people seem to spontaneously bring out their music instruments and have a good ol' jam session. Plus inside there's a pool table and a great pinball machine.

Wild Side West is primarily a lesbian bar, but everyone is very friendly and the bar welcomes all types. (On several occassions perfect strangers have invited us to join their parties and partake in their food) I don't know anyone, gay or straight, who hasn't been charmed instantly by this place.
author: Johnny H.

description: The Wild Side West was extremely unexpected.  There is the most incredible garden/patio hidden in the back of this place.  The initial interior is your standard dive bar situation with a pool table, some kitsch, and limited seating.  The garden in the back is what with take your breathe away.  It's like somebody pilfered all the most odd  pieces of furniture from backyards across the Bay and assembled them into nooks and crannies for intimate conversation.  I may have gotten one weird look from one of the lady patrons, but that could have been imagined.  I also thought I saw an animal in the garden, but it turns out it was just a leaf.  The drinks weren't magnificent because they weren't gay-man-drink-the-pain-away-bring-the-slutty-out, but some nice beers were on tap.  Overall, great neighborhood bar for lesbians, gays and all folks.  Take a walk on the wild side.  Ugh, even I hate myself for saying that.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
So many fabulous Sunday afternoons/evenings spent with my gaggle of writing friends, tucked away in some corner of the garden, surrounded by random stuff -- wonderful.

Big, rowdy, makeshift jam band belting out chestnuts under the porch.

Weird sculptures topped with plastic spiders and blow-up hammers and what's this weird old radio?  What's this plant doing in the hand of the little stone angel?  

MMMMMMmmmmm. . .
author: Rebecca S.

description: Great little bar with a killer back yard. Everyone seemed really friendly after we settled in. Great conversation starter kind of place, too. Cash only bar.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Shatangi gotta agree with Brother G. A very non scene gay-friendly establishment. Relaxed and neighborhoody.

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
I'm pretty sure I saw a gnome or some other sort of magical creature run across my feet in the back garden last time I was there.

Bonus points for being the backdrop for the WORST. DATE. EVER.  Seriously, I'm glad that now I have a truly great story for my future dates when this question comes up.  Before I had to mention the guy who couldn't stop talking about his retirement account or the snooze-fest guy.  You have to be seriously crazy for me to be able for me to pathologize you in a single hour.  Borderline personality disorder much?

Love you WSW!
author: Mat K.

description: SHHHH!  OK, never mind keeping it quite since I guess too many other yelpers like it too.  I love this dive bar. It is cool, good drinks and the patio is one of a kind.
author: S J.

description:
On a nice summer evening, this is the place to be.  The "Secret Garden"  as I like to call it, provides hideaways and niches for stolen kisses.  I love bringing dates here and even though it is considered a gay bar, I feel extremely comfortable here.  The bartenders are sweethearts and the patrons are chill.  I prefer hanging outside as opposed to inside as the inside gets crowded and there is limited seating.  

In the garden, people play instruments, laughter is abundant and there is a tranquil air about.
author: Yasmine D.

description:
As opposed to The Lexington, this queer ladies' hang out is always chill, the pool table is accessible without a lifetime of waiting and mean look giving, they won't always get your drink right, but if you lose your ID here, you will most likely get it back. NEVER a problem with parking, or bathroom wait, and you can totally take your drink out back to the sweet dimly lit-up patio for a smoke and random conversation with strangers. 

Wild Side West stands out on its' own of course, without being compared to a pretentious queer youth hang out, but I am just so excited that there is an alternative.
author: Micah R.

description: I have lived in Bernal Heights for 10 years and I really want to like this place. I have tried over and over to support my local dive bar...alas, when we sit at the bar we are treated like aliens and it is all business without a smile and a  slight mumble of recognition from the bar tendress.  Then you have to watch her stuff a burrito down her gullet and ignore us. We left like we entered.....like we were ghosts. They have Speakeasy Big Daddy on tap so I will be back, I just have to remember I am going for the beer, not the bar. Meh.
author: John A.

description:
I think this is my new best kept secret, so don't tell anyone. From the outside this place looks like a hole in the wall, when you walk in your suspicions that this is a neighborhood dive are confirmed. But order yourself a pink lady and walk straight out the back door and down the stairs to the left. the garden starts from there and keeps going, back and back. there are numerous private seating areas and it looks like they might event barbeque on the weekends.

when we got there for happy hour on a friday night, its true, it was mostly lesbians, and quite a variety of women at that. but by about 9ish when we left a there were a few boys here and there, so don't be intimidated if you haven't been to many lesbian bars before, they don't bite.

i can't wait for another hot san francisco night, wild side west kicks zeitgeist's ass! now if only the tamale lady would stop by i would be in heaven.
author: Kai H.

description: My favorite place up on Cortland to grab a beer, for certain.
author: Daniel W.

description: What a great little neighborhood bar!  Nice people, cute girls, funny kitsch (even if I'd nver want it in m own apartment), and cheap drinks. I love San Fran.
author: Sara L.

description:
I think this bar is neat, beer selection is a little slim but what they have is pretty good. The magic is in the open space outside and in the backyard.
Dyke bar, yeah, sure, but they aren't unfriendly to auslanders.
I too, experienced the dirty hippies playing music, but I managed to ignore them because I couldn't smell them.

I think this is probably Bernal's coolest bar.
author: Tom S.

description:
Things I love about Wild Side:

- The bartenders. They are hilarious, nice, and compete with the guy at The Knockout for Best Mixed Drinks in the Mission

- It's the kind of place where you end up talking to people you don't know, even if you are a bit introverted. It's just that friendly. 

- Lesbians tell great stories

- The back garden is like something out of Alice in Wonderland. You forget you are in the middle of a city

- You can book the grill out back for a party

- Good motown on the jukebox

- It's three blocks from my house, which makes it the communal living room for Bernal Heights
author: Erica F.

description: In a land of Boy Bars or Total Assimilation, this place is a good bet for a lezzie girls' night out.  Love the space, especially the table right in front of the fireplace, and the garden out back is killer!  One of my favorites in the City.
author: Annie S.

description: Perfect neighborhood bar that also happens to be 75% lesbian.  Very chill place with a cozy feel.  I've never seen it crowded but there is always a few people.  You can play pool or go hang out in there weird statue/beer garden which is delightful.  Unlike traditional beer gardens its cluttered with trees and halfassed folk art creates nooks and crannies.   Not a place to "pick up" women, but rather a fun place to unwind with your buddies.  The catch is that its on the top of bernal so you will only go there if you live on the hill.  Maybe it's for the best, if this place was easily accessible it would be ruined by the masses.
author: BeeryMcGymrat X.

description: This is my gayborhood bar and it's a great place to get a drink and actually do some relaxing. Highly unpretentious, affordable, with a fabulous patio/garden. The patrons and staff are friendly and I appreciate that everyone mixes at WSW, even though the two guys I hit on ended up being straight. Oh well...I love this bar!
author: Nick B.

description: I don't really live all that close but will happily walk the extra blocks to come here for a drink. The bartenders are awesome. Inviting outdoor patio and fun people ... a good place to hang out and chill at the outdoor patio on a sunny day!
author: M J.

description:
Haggard lesbian writers clutch to mugs poured by beautiful bartenders.  Construction workers chat over the game while enjoying ice cold servesas after work .  I love this bar, theres no pretentiousness, people are down to earth and everyone knows your name...well not everyone.  
Great bar!
author: ashanta r.

description: Isn't it amazing how things that are perfect for you can exist without your knowledge? How could I have lived in SF without knowing about Wild Side West, the coolest divey, straight friendly lesbian bar there ever was? Everything is better in Bernal Heights and Wild Side West totally proves that. The drinks are cheap and super boozy, the jukebox is great, clientele friendly & unpretentious and they have Elvis pinball. What else do you need?
author: Maria D.

description: Couldnt get a bead on this place.  Very divy.  Found out later it was a lesbian bar, but when we were there, all kinds of people were hanging out.  Some old hippie dude was playing on the pool table.  Two motorcycle dudes came in, grabbed beers and went out back.  Hetero-looking couples hanging out.  They have Pyramid apricot ale, which I didnt notice until after I ordered a Fat Tire.  The one bartender wasnt very friendly.  The other, guess it was the owner, told us the story about Domino, the cat, whose picture hangs above the bar.  That cat had some long legs.
author: brewgirl b.

description:
Wild Side West is quickly becoming my favorite bar in San Francisco. Really? you ask. That dingy little place? Well, friend, allow me to elaborate. I have never had a bad time at WSW, and I have been there, um, many times. Though this is undoubtedly due at least in part to the wonderful cohorts with whom I have had the pleasure of spending time at WSW, I have to give credit to the place itself. The jukebox is good (anything that puts Kanye West in the same collection as Al Green and classic country will automatically gain points with me), the drinks are strong and cheap, and though service can be spotty, it's really only because the bartender knows so many people that she can't help but chat a bit--- and she's always smiling. This is highly preferable to bartenders at many other bars who don't even give you the time of day. Plus, they actually respect women here, and will give us (especially we diligent and often underappreciated femmes) the preferential treatment we deserve-- not something I usually ask for, but I sure as hell do at a bar when drinks are at stake. I should also mention that this is a queer ladies' bar but by no means exclusively and by no means sceney (i.e., no cookie-cutter "hipper than thou" folk-- you know who you are) so most everyone should feel comfortable here, something I truly appreciate.

The ambience seals the deal, old-fashioned and quirky without trying too hard, like a combination of old west saloon and Victorian punch house, and the smoking patio/garden outside make for a lovely escape. Recently when some dear friends and I attended in celebration of my birthday, I had the pleasure of being serenaded "Happy Birthday" by members of a motley band who had a few moments earlier been performing holiday songs (to the best of their efforts) in order to raise money for "the old people of Chinatown who don't have any." Friends, it doesn't get much better.
author: Janine M.

description: There is something sexy about a woman bartender that could kick your ass, and they have them here. Known as a lesbian bar, but has more of a laid back neighborhood hangout feel. They have all the pre-reqs of a great bar: pool table, pinball, Galaga, and a good diverse selection of music on the jukebox (Talking Heads, Le Tigre, etc). Their courtyard on warm days is one of the best kept secrets in the city. Full rating is given for having Rolling Rock behind the counter.
author: Bucky K.

description: Probably the most fun and diverse of the night hangout spots along this strip. While the average weekday/night visitor is most likely an older local, this will also have the youngest customer base of any of the bars in the area. We used to step onto our balcony to see who was at the WSW balcony to gauge the crowd and determine whether to head over or not. Still a fun place. Verrry laid back. Fantastic outdoor area. The crowd is eclectic for sure -- especially fun to discuss politics. The late afternoon early evening sun time is the best window to start an evening here!
author: Tanya P.

description: The interior of this Bernal Heights watering hole, with its bohemian charm, resembles an old-style saloon, with a long bar, mismatched tables and chairs for playing cards, a couple of pool tables, and assorted tchotchkes on the walls. The interior takes second place to the outdoor space, with its bi-level patios, shrubbery and sculpture garden, and hidden nooks and crannies for private tete-a-tetes. Bird feeders perch on rustic artwork, while patrons relax on furniture fashioned from cinderblocks and driftwood. It's known as a lesbian haunt, but it's really more of a neighborhood hangout in a neighborhood heavily populated with lesbians. Males are more than welcome, and gay men more interested in socializing with a friendly crowd than cruising for tomorrow morning's brunch date will find its charm and character a refreshing change from the oppressive atmospheres found in Castro and SoMa bars. For basically non-bar people like myself, this is a five-star bar .
author: Gourmet G.

description: Admittedly, I was a little intimidated when I read about this place, which is why I was all the more pleasantly surprised by the laid-back atmosphere.  Certainly the most impressive part is the stairway and garden in the back.  When I was there a local neighborhood band was shooting the breeze and practicing, they weren't bad either!  Also, props for having Hot Toddies on the menu.
author: Wes M.

description: I love this bar especially when its sunny out. Has a great garden area in the back to sit out and enjoy your favorite drink. Good drink prices with a coin opp pool table. In addition Mr. Nancy makes some outstanding drinks. I've also referred some of my friends to go there and they seem to love it too.
author: Roc O.

description: The back patio is what I'd want my backyard to look like, minus the dirty hippies playing "mildly offensive" music.  Note to the wise: the bathroom on the right is much nicer than the one on the left, plus you get to admire the artist who turned a regular penis drawing into a happy elephant!
author: Jess T.

description: cool and comfortable. would love to come back when it's warmer and hang on the ah-mazing back patio. until then, I'll enjoy the decor, jukebox, and strong drinks
author: Caddy M.

description:
think "the secret garden" 
add beer
add hidden bbq grills
that is wild side west
it feels so exciting in this very childlike way to wander through the endless garden seeking out the perfect little nook to make your own...
there are far too few outside drinking locales in this city and this one has even taken the trouble to make the garden cool!
author: Sole A.

description: Great neighborhood bar.  Of course, the patio with its nooks and crannies allows both privacy and coziness to meet new friends(like we did tonight!).  I especially love the fireplace for those cold SF nights.
author: michelle s.

description:
No matter what, any bar with a good beer garden always gets 5 stars from me.  wsw has one of the better beer gardens I've seen - or rather, one of the most unique.  The bar itself feels like an old time saloon that's gone berserk.  The patrons and bartenders are so nice.  One time I was there with a buddy and the bartender was talking to her friends; although there were about five other people in the bar, she spent a full minute finishing up her conversation with her friends.  I liked that.  I can appreciate a place where there's no real rush and the rockin older butch bartender takes her time wrapping up the conversation she's having with the two women across the bar before serving the guys that just walked in.  Right on.

When you walk out into the beer garden it's like in the remake of "Great Expectations" with Gwyneth Paltrow and Ethan Hawke when they enter Paradiso Perduto and the ethereal music starts playing, there are old fountains filled with leaves and statues, empty claw-footed bathtubs with vines growing on them, etc.  Rad!!!
author: Mr. A.

description: Fun,divey mixed bar. Love the musty funk! Good jukebox. The back garden is a magical place. So many nooks and crannies to snuggle in or just hang with your special peeps. My only complaint is the staff. The bartendresses are not always the most friendly or attentive. I have stood at the empty bar for ten minutes just to get a beer. Ouch!
author: sockanooni s.

description:
the infamous lesbian bar...
and yes i have seen them there..  the ones w/the short hair, the ones who wear the sport coats, the lipstick ones...  it's cool though, they're real cool.

so i've been here w/an old male friend...he took me to the romanitc patio.. it's real cute.. not like romantic pretty and shit.  but i mean great vegetation, cute lights around the plants/trees... random benches... you could get cozy here w/a hot date...  too bad i wasn't really into this guy...  so it wasn't much of a romantic night..  but i dream of taking my bf who i am into here one day.. then it will be a romantic night..

1 great memory about this place...the lesbian w/the sports coat beating my old male friend's ass in pool.  that was a hilarious scene to see.  she knew she was gonna kick some serious ass too.. what more a man.. her chest was puffin' out.  

i lost my pipe here.. later coming back to get it back in it's little pouch, sans the trees, but it was great there are good herb samaritans out there!
author: Sheri N.

description: A really great space and almost all the people are great.  But twice I've been there during the day (and read about someone having the same experience in the guardian I think) when some lady was trying to work out some inane cover on her guitar while playing snippets over and over.  This should not be done in public that's why jesus invented houses.
author: Ed B.

description: You don't want to come here. It's not for you. Nope no fun at all just keep on walking. Really just stay away.
author: paul a.

description: My heart was lost somewhere deep in a jaeger bomb at the highest hour of the night. Thank you.
author: Kiki C.

description: I should have been coming here because this is the spot in the neighborhood! It's lively and fun and everyone has such a great energy! There's games, music and a pool table--pick your favorite. And the drinks are good and at a good price! I love it! I will be coming back here again!!! Fun Fun Fun! :)
author: Mel P.

description: I love WSW's creative use of restroom items such as the bathtub planters in the back, the toilet-seats-turned-picture-frames on the walls. I love that they have Salt n' Peppa AND Willie Nelson on the jukebox (get out of my HEAD wild side). You've read enough about the back patio at this point but seriously, it is rad. I love the one Elvis-like bartender despite, and maybe because of, her goldfish-like memory of drink orders and resulting abracadabra prices she comes up with. Spent many a birthday and date here.  Even had the Indian pizza joint deliver here for my birthday, it was a-okay with the ladies of wild side. Its a trek but I need to get there again soon (and just stop bothering with the Lex altogether).
author: Abby S.

description: A friend and I ended up here after we decide we wanted a drink and a bar neither of us had been to before. It was a wonderful surprise. It was exciting to discover the back garden. It has wonderful seating nooks and even a porch swing. It was on the chilly side that night, but we toughed it out and had a few (too many) beers. I will definitely go back when the weather warms up. I have a feeling it will quickly become a favorite!
author: Amy C.

description:
okay people....just because san fran is a veritable dryland for lesbian bars, ya don't have to give EVERY one of them an automatic 5 stars

that said, WSW is a great bar...like a clean dive with lots more character..very friendly folks...and a woodstove!

if it had more pool tables and a bit more space, i might give it 5 stars

tip:  if you are hungry, the italian place across the street and up 2 doors is phenomenal...awesome bruchetta and pizza...and you can bring food into the bar
author: Guinnivere B.

description: I actually like this bar a lot.  It's just so quaint and almost campy.  The bartenders are nice.  It has always been a mixed crowd there...gay, straight, sporty, not so sporty, etc.  They have a nice patio garden area to enjoy when it's not so cold.  I like that the bathroom sink is outside of the toilet area, you can see who washes their hands after tinkling.  :)
author: jen n.

description: You could easily miss the big deal about this bar if you don't do a little exploring... the massive garden in the back is what it's all about.  A little creepy, but in a good way.
author: Sleuthy W.

description: This is a good place, the people are always really nice, the decor is funky, they have a pool table and they have a great patio out back, which is perfect for smokers, and there are all these nooks and crannies so you can have some privacy,there are always people playin acoustic guitares out there. I really like this place, but my heart belongs across the street
author: JIll H.

description: "I only had a moment in this bar, the drinks seem pretty standard as did the pool table and the jukebox. However the two items promot this bar above most of the hundreds of sf bars are the back yard/patio and the clientele. The people are a mix of age and coolness. The young and old mix as do the hipster and that dude in sweat pants. A back patio in an SF bar is rarer than a pitcher of ice tea in hell, but even so this yard is a stand out, with discreet night lighting, fountains, trees and plants, statues, art work, and for lack of a better name, little make-out nooks. I was enamored instantly. All of that and Maggiemudd is only blocks away."
author: Ian H.

description: Well, I'm not a lesbian either, and I also like this bar! I have been here about 5 times and each time that I have been outside in the back, there have been friendly types of all shapes, sizes, and cultures offering you a smoke of the regular or the wacky tobacco type. It's quite a nice place to hang out.
author: Scott M.

description:
super great place to be drunk at.

weird ass backyard with all sorts of statues and shit strewn around it. bad times if you are drunk because if you are like me you will lose balance and fall onto a statue and bang up your legs.

strong drinks

pretty good prices

rad marys and very good mojitos which im sure they hate making. they let you bbq in back,bring weiners and you are set!
author: Lauren V.

description: Just a four block walk from home, who can complain about that... the back is great to sit with friends in the sunshine and the pool table is always inviting... I'm really gald to have this in my neighaborhood!
author: Joy C.

description: Fun kitschy decor, good jukebox, great outdoor patio and back yard, and wonderful mix of all types of people.  Not the kind of bar you take a clean freak to, though, unless they don't mind seeing the occasional rat running along the trees.  But I love it!
author: Bodacious T.

description: This is exactly like your neighbohood bar but instead of older retired dudes wearing poorly-fitted ballcaps, think older retired women. Had a great time here one night a while back with a friend; the bartender was cool as were the patrons. Great place for shooting the shit or starting an evening off.
author: Karsten P.

description: Best lil garden bar in SF!!! Rumor has it Janis Joplin got down on the pool table.
author: Amaris B.

description: One of the best outdoor drinking spots in SF. Drinking a mojito on a bench hidden in the labyrinthine plants = Happiness.
author: Saleema F.

description: You are a guy and you go into a bar with paintings and pictures of nude women on the walls, sports on the t.v. and occasionally two women are making out---and no sexual tension. It is like the womb! A secret entertainment is out back at night when you can watch rats scurry up the palm trees. Great bar!
author: Stephen S.

description:
This is my favorite neighborhood bar. It's very laid back, the drinks are cheap, pool is 50 cents per game, and there is a bizarre garden in the back. sometimes people bring their own guitars and play music. No one cares what you do. 

While this is a lesbian bar, everyone is really welcome there. I would say you might not even know it was a lesbian bar at first. Many people from the neighborhood hang out there, straight men, gay men, gay women, straight women, etc. I have never felt weird as a guy there and there are always all stripes of life hanging out there. 

On big football days, they have a "football boo-fay" which consists of hot dogs and baked beans on wonder bread hot dog rolls. It's pretty amazing!
author: Gieusse P.

description:
I came here a few years ago to slake my thirst after walking my lazy ass up to the top of Bernal.  I forgot everything about this bar except the nonfunctional fireplace strewn with odd shoes in the middle of the room.  BUT I missed out on the best part, which I discovered last night: THE PATIO.  
This ranks among the neatest (yes, I said NEAT) outdoor patios I've seen in SF and beyond.  It's like a secret garden with several intimate sitting areas, funky old junk decor, and porch swing.  At night, cords of bright-colored lights provide the only light and friends sip and chat in the dusk.  
We had a great time sipping Mickey's grenades and soaking up the bayou-like ambiance provided by the guy with a banjo (!).  
The beers were of average price, the crowd inside was fun and friendly, and the bartenders chatted us up appropriately.  
It's like an old shack full of your friends where you can play in the backyard.  And it's a bar!
author: Eric S.

description: The back patio is simply awesome. The moment I went out there I literally got lost, okay maybe I just had a little too much to drink. Still, having a pool table to greet you is all I need to hang out with my dikes.
author: Bernard V.

description: I am not a lesbian but I like this bar. The open patio/backyard area is very nice. The whole decoration is very peaceful and cool. If you have a small group friends and want to relax and talk a bit. That's a good place to go.
author: Yina M.

description:
one of the things that i  miss most about living in SF is wild side west. i was always dragging my friends up to bernal heights to go to this place. it's HELLA worth the climb up cortland street! that's right, i said hella. 

i miss the garden, the cheap booze, the elvis pinball machine and the ms. pac man.... i miss listening to random people playing their guitars in the garden outside... miss watching folks get all competitive over a game of pool...miss the jukebox...miss considering buying a pack of american spirits behind the bar just because i was tipsy...

the only thing that i don't really miss about the place was the service. it always seemed to me that if you weren't one of the regulars, it took extra long to get served. still, it's hard to complain about this place...
author: Joanna M.

description: i love this place!  My friends first turned me on to it long ago and I now never pass up the opportunity to go.  Sure, its far from the middle of town, and it might take you a while to get served a drink depending on who is bartending, but it is a great place.  The garden outside is nice.  Great to find an alcove and chill with friends or get a little frisky with a special someone in a dark corner ;) mmmmhmmmm!
author: Suzanne L.

description: Wild Side has a great vibe. Been going there for years and love the outdoor spaces, particularly the back patio in the afternoon on a sunny day. The conversations are always interesting and I've never felt out of place as a breeder. The bartenders are great, especially Tierney, Regina and Mr. Nancy, who is a veritable encyclopedia of punk rock knowledge, and the drink prices are the best in the city. Buds are 2 bucks and Anchors are 4 bucks. Can't beat it with a stick. And you can almost always park right out front.....Any other places like this? Let me know and I'll check them out, but I sort of doubt it.
author: Armand C.

description: The eden in the back, and the groovy, dreamy lighting. Who cares about the drinks (though they're fine). They could serve pickle juice and I'd still love this place. Pool and garden haven under the stars. So magical, tucked away like a perfect secret.
author: Cate F.

description:
Thanks, Yelpers... This place is cool.  From the bar that looks like something out of Alaska in the 20's, to the garden in back with nooks, crannies and a clawfoot tub made into a planter! We went on a Friday evening (6 p.m.) with a friend from Chicago.  The place was a little dead, but picked up quickly.  Many places to hide out in the garden, have a beer and just kick back.  The fact that it has been described as a "lesbian"  bar is a bit misleading.  There are lesbians, there are straight people, and everyone was incredibly mellow.  I can't see anyone having a bad time here unless they listen to Rush or Hannity on a daily basis.  Oh, and to the people at the bar that night.. Sorry about our Chicago friend snapping photos.  He just thought it was a cool place.  I know it seemed like the old "straight guy from out of town shooting pictures of S.F. lesbians", but he just thought the bar was incredibly unique. 

Warning... I'm bringing my guitar next time.
author: Mike M.

description: How can you beat the friendly vibe, the awesome garden, and the laid back atmosphere?  It's pretty much the only place I take my friends for a drink and a conversation.
author: Brent D.

description: One of my favorite bars in the City. It's enough to make you look at "For Rent" signs in the neighborhood! Lovely backyard garden.
author: Juliette T.

description: This place is fun if you want to go and chill and have a conversation. Say...for a first date. I recommend going early (so maybe a place to go before you hit the night clubs) and checking out the back yard/ sitting area. Wonderful art, great drinks and fine woman.
author: Heather S.

description: The absolute best lesbian bar in the city... but no pussy drinks here!!  I'm so happy I live in Bernal Heights!
author: Renee A.

description: I've been to the WSW many times and only by default since I live up the street. I like to support the neighborhood businesses even if it is the filthiest place I've ever been in, dirty tables, restrooms etc. I know, lets try a remodel, paint, dump the dated crap on the walls and fireplace and give it a new start. Now the rest of the story: The Bartenders, OMFG!!!! Horrible, I actually watched the bartender ring up $4.00 for our round of drinks (4) and charged us $21.00. So lets see, 4-21=17.00, she's making bank! They have the same miserable bartenders everyday, lacking personalty, class, and conversation, which explains why they have no business. It would be very hard to have a business on Courtland and fail, the only competition would be the Stray bar up the street and that smells like a urinal. Since the "New Owner" came into play, we all hoped she would clean the place up, add a little class and charm. That didn't happen. My friends and I went there the other night...again, to play pool, thinking it changed. It did, they now have a male bartender, WTF!! So, the place is now officially a dump, but why bring a male bartender into the picture? Is this a form of desperation or it's going to the men? No longer a lesbian place?? This place had great potential with the right people and different owners working it, it would be 5 deep at the bar. So it's off to the Lexington for a good drink with a bartender that has a personalty and a sense of humor.
author: Joy P.

description: We used to come across town to hang out at this laid-back bar. Now it's our 'local' and we couldn't be happier. It's best to go on a sunny afternoon and hang out in the cozy back garden. Everyone at WSW -- the patrons and the staff -- are great. Even my guy friends feel welcome.
author: anita c.

description: This is a well known lesbian hang out.  I'm not a lesbian but loved it all the same.  I enjoyed the back yard/patio area...you are instantly transported from a dive bar to a different world when you walk out the back door.  Groups are playing folk music on guitars and lounging around between the thousands of plants.  Comfortable place since it's pretty quiet and homey.
author: Allison K.

description: Hot lesbians, good beer on tap and billiards.  Need I say more?
author: Walter C.

description: LOVE this bar!!!  I don't even know where to begin.  Cheap drinks, friendly, casual atmosphere.  I LOVE the back yard.  A great place for Lesbians and well, anyone.  I much prefer this bar to the Lexington any day.   A nice mixed crowed without the hipster attitude.
author: Amanda G.

description: Nice bar with a lot of interesting decor. The patio area in the back is pretty cool. I heard some interesting conversations while I was back there. There was a lively crowd in there on a friday night, and even though I heard this was a lesbian bar, there were plenty of people of all orientations, including me and my gf. The parking around here could be a pain but if you're not driving then its good for a few pops.
author: D J.

description: I would have given it 5 stars, but it's just so hard for me to get to.  What's up with public transportation to Bernal Heights?  I love the outdoor deck and garden, where I once spend almost 6 hours one Sunday.  Cheap beer, cute girls, and sunny afternoons make the Wild Side a great place to spend a lazy day.  Plus they love my friend Cat.  They even made a sign proclaiming their love for her.  So it's all good with me.
author: Lauren D.

description: Relaxed and friendly bar with an awesome jungle like backyard.  Seriously, you could get lost in their backyard after a few drinks.  Always seems to be some random person playing a guitar down there.  The bar itself is pretty standard, with a nice pool table and a few places to sit.  Good strong drinks if my wife orders them.
author: John K.

description: WSW is tucked into a tiny house on Cortland Avenue, but the facade is deceptive. Step inside and discover the huge back garden, which is full of art and strung with lights, and has plenty of quiet secluded areas with porch swings and tables. It's a wonderful getaway -- you feel like you're in someone's artsy backyard, a little like Zeitgeist but with more shrubbery and without all the drunken yelling.
author: Beth W.

description: Best dyke bar I've ever been to, although, you'd never know it without venturing out back, down the stairs, through the myriad secret garden nooks where you may want to make yourselves a little more comfortable. And the best part is the unpretentious yet innately hip clientele (if that isn't too self-aggrandizing), impromptu banjo ballads and sing-alongs in the "music" nook, and the strangely (yet dangerously) rejuvenating quality this place has...for a bar. I'm a bit mystified.
author: M A.

description: What happened to the murals????? I loved them and now it is a big white boring wall of .......nothingness.
author: Deborah R.

description: very comfortable and cozy atmosphere and a magical back patio (but the patio closes at 10pm) i can't wait for long summer days so I can enjoy the patio in daylight. pool is only $.50 and the bar has a great selection of beer, wine and liquor. they even have specialty cocktails! the juke box has a decent selection and is fairly priced and there is a nice fire place as well. i can't wait to go back i just wish wild side west were closer to my house.
author: Leuwam T.

description: Gay, straight, questioning - it doesn't matter here. If you're alive, you will enjoy the back garden at this Bernal Hill haven.  From the community of musicians that gather on weekends to the 20 somethings rolling special cigs, this is a SF MUST SEE. You won't find tourists all the way out here. Start your afternoon with a hike up the hill and chase it was a pear cider from WSW. This is possibly my favorite bar anywhere in the world.
author: Jessica M.

description: I love this bar, its got that only in San Francisco saloon/dive/queerbar vibe with anchor on tap and a friendly attitude to us straight folk. Oh ya and the back yard rips.
author: Gabe L.

description: Great lively bar and can be overly crowded at times.  Nice garden on warm days.  Bartenders are fantastic.
author: May M.

description: Sometimes the bartenders are a little surly, but the back garden more than makes up for it.  I recommend taking a Stella and a Jameson out there with your besties on a sunny day.
author: Hallie M.

description: Wild side is a San Francisco institution.  I'm told that Janis played pool on the same table that is there today.  Drinks are pretty solid, and the ambiance is cool.  The garden out back is just cool, intimate and interesting.  Friday night - you can feel the girl power.  Lots of fun.
author: Fiid W.

description: One of the great bars of the City. I've spent many a night closing this place down. Always an interesting crowd having a good time. The bartenders are memorable and the juke box is filled with a broad range of great tunes. I am glad they cleaned up the back patio area, however- it used to be swarming with vermin late at night. But now it is very safe since they took the seed filled bird-feeders out and got a cat to patrol the area.
author: Stefan Y.

description: Best bar on Bernal Heights! The back patio and yard are great for a sunny afternoon buzz, and the bartenders kick ass. Everything you could want in a bar.
author: Chris R.

description:
My gf and I have been interested in checking this place out for months, since there's definitely a lack of lesbian bars in S.F. Finally made it out, so to speak, and I'm glad we did. It was really low-key, pretty slow (especially for a Saturday), but it has a great vibe and good-priced drinks. Bartenders were cool, and I've no complaints. 

Only reason the place didn't get five stars (can't do 4.5) is that it didn't really feel ... well ... gay. Not that that's a bad thing; my big knock on the Lex is that it's too butch. Wild Side West feels much more inclusive, which isn't a bad thing, but it's not as "gay" as I would've thought.
author: andrea a.

description: Loove this place!  The garden in the back feels like you've stepped right into the secret garden, complete with overgrown vines, little white wrought iron benches and hidden nooks.  Awesome bartenders and chill crowd.  Maybe I haven't been there on a really busy night when it could potentially get rowdy, but it's been laid back the two times I've been there.
author: Tanya P.

description: I really like this place, great neighborhood bar and the oldest lesbian bar in SF! The crowd is mixed, gay and straight. Great beer garden, pool table and a descent juke box. Regina is definitely my favorite bartender there.  My only wish is for the bartenders to buy back once in a while.  Also, they don't have a happy hour which is kind of a bummer.  Besides that it's a really good place to meet new people. Definitely a must!
author: Linda M.

description: I'm not a lesbian but I love this bar.  The drinks are cheap and they have a fun cocktail menu, but only take cash.  The bartenders can be a little surly, but that just adds to the atmosphere of the place.  The highlight is really the back garden.  It winds around and surprises you with little nooks which are great for private conversations, and they have areas good for large groups.  We make a beeline for this place any time there is a warm night (which of course is rare in San Francisco).
author: Jimmy C.

description: supposedly for lesbians but i am cool with lesbians so i like it.  even though i am not a lesbian.  not that i am not cool with lesbians.  anyway!  love the lesbian patio in the back!  just kidding, i will stop.  go here on a warm(ish) summer night and the next evening you will find yourself driving here even though you meant to go home.  the first time i visited, i ended up returning 3 times that same week.  this tells you two things...1)  wild side west is a great bar with a magical back patio and 2) i am a horrible, terrible lush.
author: Laura B.

description: I love this little neighborhood bar but the bartenders are awful! If you dont feel like drinking then go to Wild Side. I went in and there was only 3 people at the bar and the bartender completely ignored me and was taking shots with her friends.
author: Doug S.

description: good bartenders, mixed crowd, multiple chandeliers, shoes lying around a fireplace and a giant backyard in which to puff all kinds of smoke.  five stars.
author: Charly G.

description: What can I say about this place?  Well, let's just start off with the atmosphere.  It's pretty laid back, with several regular patrons who enjoy chatting with the bartenders and others.  The jukebox is good, probably could do with some updated cd's, but good enough for me when i've had a few cocktails in my system and can't even hear the music by that time.  There's a really cool and eclectic outdoor patio/garden (urinals and other bathroom fixtures are perfect pieces for art).  Plus, the pool table never has a long line.  Anything else...oh yeah, there's one of those sit down multiple video game console thingy's, a Galaga/Ms. Pac Man game, and a pinball game that they always seem to rotate out every so often.  No attitude, easy parking, great selection of alcohol, yummy specials, and snacks.  What else could you ask for?  Well, actually, I would ask for more tables, but hey, I'll take the easy parking anyday over the option of more tables.  Oh, and I really like the fact that the bartenders don't mind if I bring my own food in.
author: Kris G.

description: Very relaxed neighborhood bar... their back patio is like an enormous secret garden... wonderful seating, art, and landscaping. The patio closes earlier than the rest of the bar so don't show up late and expect to be able to be outside in the gardens. This is a lesbian bar that is extremely welcoming to all...
author: Michael H.

description: Even though WSW is listed as a "gay" bar, I always find it just as much a neighborhood bar.  The back yard area is very comfortable, and there are plenty of secluded places to get a little privacy if you just want to talk or something. And no attitude. Definitely a plus.
author: J M.

description: this is one of my favorite bars. amazing garden, ramshackle with lots of nooks and crannies to sit in. murals in the bathrooms. fireplace inside. pool. cool bartenders who check my id every time i go there(thanks). the perfect place to take shelter in a rainstorm, or a sunny afternoon.
author: nattles l.

description: this is a amazing bar.  the backyard here easily surpasses el rio in its greatness. it reminds me of my eccentric hippy grandma that never left her little suburban cottage and grows, if i had one of those.  theres a big fireplace in the middle of the bar and it is covered in high heels and other various painful footwear.  the barkeeps are nice and efficient, but youre not there for them.  after you get your drink (you can get a hot toddie or irish coffee btw!) go outside.  the patio is nice but dark and boring.  go downstairs to your right and theres a little lighted area under the patio where people seem to have sing alongs and jam sessions, nothing too granola and if its not your scene you can keep going.  farther in you'll find nooks here and there to stash yourself to talk or smoke or 'whathaveyou'.  all in all, its a fun adult version of swiss family robinson meets the smurfs.
author: regan g.

description: GREAT outdoor patio, extremely diverse group of very friendly folks -- behind and in front of the bar.
author: DD M.

description: i started at the wild side getting bloody mary's with my friends on sunday mornings. they had this bartender, robb, who opened the joint early--10am--on sundays in football season. we didn't give a shit about the games, we'd order up the bloodys and take them in the amazing back yard. you've got to see the garden by both daylight and at night. the only drag is that the garden closes early, but it's not the bar's fault. the drinks are strong, the air is friendly, and you're bound to meet true san francisco natives at the bar. it's a true favorite!
author: Sidney B.

description: chill and fabulous dyke bar, back garden and patio are awesome, classic lesbians and younger dykes abound!
author: Erika Y.

description: wsw is a perfect neighborhood bar. the patio is great on warm summer evenings. i've ended a few memorable nights there including NYE when they sold drinks to my group, then kicked us out (they were closing) a mere 30 seconds later. gotta admire their tough love style. plus, i scored a whole new set of pint and whiskey glasses that night. thanks wsw, you're the best!
author: Megan S.

description: i came here last nite, on a wednesday night around hmm 10 maybe? for my first time there. yes, i said on a previous review i doubted id go back to bernal heights, but apparently i did. so, wild side west was dead. there were maybe ten people in there. i couldnt really tell it was a lesbian bar, it just looked like a bar. kind of a dive bar, with lots of weird decorations, including a fluffy white thing we couldnt figure out what it was. there is a jukebox for music, and z put in some songs but we never heard them.  mostly old type music in there but some random things like a missy cd and justin timberlake. but mostly old countrywestern or rock or whatever. i dont even know. neither of us drank anything, so cant comment there. the reason why this basically empty bar in the middle of nowhere got 4 stars is because of the garden. if you go out the back and down the steps, there is a garden, just like someone's backyard. there were just 2 other people there, who i scared away by accidentally talking about rapes. they were fake, movie rapes, but they didnt know, and they got scared. stopped conversation, stared at us worriedly, then pretty much left their drinks where they were and ran. the garden is decorated with old tubs and sinks and random junk objects which create a sculpture type effect. it is very modern artsy and i enjoyed it. it was a great place to sit and chat, just like we were in our own backyard. the neighbors did close their window. if 2 people talking bother then then imagine what happens when theres a crowd out there on the weekend. i imagine there must be a crowd there at some point. so go there on a weekday night (in my neighborhood everyone is out, but in bernal heights theyre asleep or dead or something) and you can have the place all to yourself.
author: Merredith L.
